analyzed: de dang 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa yang mi srid pa kho na ste /
translated: The perception of that which is contradictory to it and so forth are also impossible.

original: de ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir chos thams cad dben pa dang 'ga' yang lhan cig 'gal ba la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir chos thams cad dben pa dang 'ga' yang lhan cig 'gal ba la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is extremely hidden, the emptiness of all phenomena and the nonestablishment of contradiction and so forth are not established.

original: 'on te grub na ni de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa kho na dngos po nyid du grub pa'i phyir mi 'dod par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te grub na ni de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa kho na dngos po nyid du grub pa'i phyir mi 'dod par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But if they were established, then that which is contradictory to it and so forth would be established as entities, and so it would not be the case that they are not accepted.

original: 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi 'gal ba ni rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi 'gal ba ni rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Thus the contradiction of entities is posited in two ways:

original: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the definition of that which does not abide together and the definition of that which abides mutually excluding the other.

original: de la rgyu ma tshang ba med pa gang zhig gang yod pas nges par med pa de gnyis ni 'gal ba dang por rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu ma tshang ba med pa gang zhig gang yod pas nges par med pa de gnyis ni 'gal ba dang por rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Of these, those two which definitely do not exist when a cause that is not incomplete exists are posited as the first contradiction.

original: dper na grang ba dang tsha ba'i reg pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na grang ba dang tsha ba'i reg pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the contact of cold and heat.

original: gang la gang zhig yongs su gcod pa gang rnam par gcad pa med na med pa de gnyis ni de la 'gal ba gnyis par rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: gang la gang zhig yongs su gcod pa gang rnam par gcad pa med na med pa de gnyis ni de la 'gal ba gnyis par rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: When one thing is excluded from another, and that exclusion is not excluded from it, those two are posited as mutually exclusive.

original: dper na chos can gcig la cig car dngos po yod pa dang med pa dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chos can gcig la cig car dngos po yod pa dang med pa dag lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the existence and nonexistence of an entity in one basis at one time.

original: 'gal ba de lta bu rnam pa gnyis ka yang chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba la mi srid pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba de lta bu rnam pa gnyis ka yang chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba la mi srid pa kho na ste /
translated: Both of these two types of contradiction are impossible for those who advocate that all phenomena are essenceless.

original: nam mkha'i autpala la sogs pa la rgyu ma tshang ba nyid kyang med la gzhan rnam par gcad pas yongs su gcod pa yang med de /
analyzed: nam mkha'i autpala la sogs pa la rgyu ma tshang ba nyid kyang med la gzhan rnam par gcad pas yongs su gcod pa yang med de /
translated: For example, it is like the nonexistence of the incompleteness of causes in such things as a sky-lotus, and the nonexistence of the exclusion of other in the exclusion of that.

original: de ni dngos po'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dngos po'i mtha' yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the limit of entities.

original: yod par rnam par gcad pas 'di yongs su gcod par rnam par 'jog mod kyi /
analyzed: yod par rnam par gcad pas 'di yongs su gcod par rnam par 'jog mod kyi /
translated: It is true that the exclusion of existence is posited as the exclusion of that.

original: de yang la lar yod pa 'ga' zhig rnam par gcad pa grub na /
analyzed: de yang la lar yod pa 'ga' zhig rnam par gcad pa grub na /
translated: But that is established if the existence of something is excluded in some context.

original: grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: grub par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: But that is not established.

original: khyed ni gang du yang gang zhig rnam par gcad par 'gyur ba gang yang yod pa mi 'dod do //
analyzed: khyed ni gang du yang gang zhig rnam par gcad par 'gyur ba gang yang yod pa mi 'dod do //
translated: You do not accept that anything is eliminated anywhere.

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid nye ba yin na khyed la rgyu ma tshang ba med pa 'ga' yang yod par ma grub po //
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid nye ba yin na khyed la rgyu ma tshang ba med pa 'ga' yang yod par ma grub po //
translated: If the absence of intrinsic reality of all things is near at hand, then for you, no cause is established as complete.

original: ji ste grub na ni rgyu ma tshang ba med pa gang yin pa de nyid dngos po grub par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ste grub na ni rgyu ma tshang ba med pa gang yin pa de nyid dngos po grub par gyur pa yin no //
translated: If it is established, then whatever is a complete cause is itself an established thing.

original: gal te chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam par gcad pas ngo bo nyid 'ga' zhig yongs su gcod par gyur na ni de'i tshe de nyid kho bo cag gi dngos po bsgrubs par yang 'gyur bas de lta na re zhig de dang 'gal ba
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid rnam par gcad pas ngo bo nyid 'ga' zhig yongs su gcod par gyur na ni de'i tshe de nyid kho bo cag gi dngos po bsgrubs par yang 'gyur bas de lta na re zhig de dang 'gal ba
translated: If the absence of intrinsic reality of all things is eliminated, then some intrinsic reality would be ascertained. At that time, that itself would be established as our thing.

original: dmigs pa mi srid do //üîΩde mi srid @136a * //
analyzed: dmigs pa mi srid do // de mi srid @136a * //
translated: In that case, first, it is not possible to observe a contradiction.

original: na 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa la sogs pa yang mi srid pa kho na ste /
analyzed: na 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa la sogs pa yang mi srid pa kho na ste /
translated: If that is not possible, then it is absolutely impossible to observe the pervasion by contradiction and so on.

original: de thams cad 'gal bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir 'gal ba ma grub na de dag kyang mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thams cad 'gal bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir 'gal ba ma grub na de dag kyang mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all of those are distinguished by contradiction, and if contradiction is not established, those are impossible.

original: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yang khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa'i dngos po yang dag par grub na khyab par bya ba dgag pa'i phyir rab tu sbyor ba yin na /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yang khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa'i dngos po yang dag par grub na khyab par bya ba dgag pa'i phyir rab tu sbyor ba yin na /
translated: Non-apprehension of the pervader is employed to refute the pervaded when the nature of the pervaded and the pervader is established.

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa ma yin pa nyid la ni gang gis kyang khyab par ma grub po //
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa ma yin pa nyid la ni gang gis kyang khyab par ma grub po //
translated: But in the case of the non-entityness of all phenomena, no one has established a pervasion.

original: ji ste grub na ni khyab pa gang yin pa de nyid dngos por grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste grub na ni khyab pa gang yin pa de nyid dngos por grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were a pervasion, then that very pervasion would establish an entity.

original: rgyu mi dmigs pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub na 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo nyid dgag pa'i phyir rab tu sbyor ba yin na /
analyzed: rgyu mi dmigs pa yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub na 'bras bu'i rang gi ngo bo nyid dgag pa'i phyir rab tu sbyor ba yin na /
translated: Non-apprehension of the cause is employed to refute the nature of the effect when the nature of cause and effect is established.

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa med do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por grub pa med do //
translated: But in the case of the non-entityness of all phenomena, the nature of cause and effect is not established.

original: grub na ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa de nyid dngos por grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grub na ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa de nyid dngos por grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were established, then that which is cause and effect would be established as a thing.

original: chos thams cad la yang gang zhig bkag pas 'di dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ba'i byed rgyu gcig pu ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: chos thams cad la yang gang zhig bkag pas 'di dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du 'grub par 'gyur ba'i byed rgyu gcig pu ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: And there is no single cause whatsoever that is refuted in regard to all phenomena, by which their realitylessness would be established.

original: kha cig gis dbang phyug la sogs pa byed rgyu gcig pu khas blangs pa gang yin pa de bkag kyang 'di dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du ni 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha cig gis dbang phyug la sogs pa byed rgyu gcig pu khas blangs pa gang yin pa de bkag kyang 'di dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du ni 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And even if one were to refute the single cause of all things, such as God, etc., as asserted by some, still their realitylessness would not be established,

original: thams cad rang gi rgyu kho na las skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad rang gi rgyu kho na las skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because all of them arise from their own causes.

original: 'di dag ni so so rang rang gi rgyu dgag par bya bar yang mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni so so rang rang gi rgyu dgag par bya bar yang mi nus te /
translated: And it is not possible to refute the individual causes of each of them,

original: de ni grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are well known.

original: gzhan yang bdag med pa chos thams cad kyi yul can du sgrub na de'i tshe dpe ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag med pa chos thams cad kyi yul can du sgrub na de'i tshe dpe ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, if one were to establish the selflessness which has all phenomena for its object, then at that time the example would not be established.

original: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa dpe gang dag yin pa de dag kyang kha cig ni phyi'i dngos po'i ngo bo kho nar 'dod la /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa dpe gang dag yin pa de dag kyang kha cig ni phyi'i dngos po'i ngo bo kho nar 'dod la /
translated: Some of the examples such as reflections are asserted to be the nature of external things,

original: gzhan dag ni shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dod pas de dag dngos po nyid du 'dod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dod pas de dag dngos po nyid du 'dod pa kho na yin no //
translated: but others are asserted to be the nature of consciousness. Therefore, they are asserted to be real.

original: 'on te nyi tshe ba'i bdag med pa bsgrub par 'dod la /
analyzed: 'on te nyi tshe ba'i bdag med pa bsgrub par 'dod la /
translated: But if you assert the establishment of a limited selflessness,

original: de la yang gal te mu stegs pas kun brtags pa'i gtso bo la sogs pa 'gog par byed na ni de'i tshe grub pa sgrub par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la yang gal te mu stegs pas kun brtags pa'i gtso bo la sogs pa 'gog par byed na ni de'i tshe grub pa sgrub par byed pa nyid do //
translated: if you refute the primal matter imagined by the tƒ´rthikas, then you are simply establishing what is already established.

original: 'on te 'jig rten na grags pa gzugs la sogs pa yin na ni de'i tshe dpe yang med la /
analyzed: 'on te 'jig rten na grags pa gzugs la sogs pa yin na ni de'i tshe dpe yang med la /
translated: But if you refute the form, etc., that is renowned in the world, then you have no example,

original: dam bcas pa yang mngon sum dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: dam bcas pa yang mngon sum dang 'gal lo //
translated: and your thesis contradicts direct perception.

original: gzhan yang gal te rjes su dpag pa'i 'brel pa rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir mngon sum tshad mar khas len na @136b ni de'i tshe dngos por grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te rjes su dpag pa'i 'brel pa rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir mngon sum tshad mar khas len na @136b ni de'i tshe dngos por grub pa nyid de /
translated: Moreover, if you accept direct perception as valid knowledge in order to establish the connection of inference, then things are established.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid ni rtog pa dang bral zhing ma nor ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid ni rtog pa dang bral zhing ma nor ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the definition of direct perception is ‚Äúfree from conceptuality and non-erroneous.‚Äù

original: ma nor ba'i shes pas gtan la phab pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dag kyang ji ltar rjes su dpag pas gsal bar bya bar nus /
analyzed: ma nor ba'i shes pas gtan la phab pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dag kyang ji ltar rjes su dpag pas gsal bar bya bar nus /
translated: And how can the nature of things ascertained by non-erroneous consciousness be clarified by inference?

original: de sel na ni mngon sum la gnod pa byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de sel na ni mngon sum la gnod pa byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is refuted, then direct perception is undermined.

original: de la gnod na ni rjes su dpag pa yang legs par mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gnod na ni rjes su dpag pa yang legs par mi gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is undermined, then inference is not well-founded.

original: mngon sum de nyid las 'brel pa thob pa'i rjes su dpag pas yang de nyid la gnod pa byed par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: mngon sum de nyid las 'brel pa thob pa'i rjes su dpag pas yang de nyid la gnod pa byed par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could inference, which obtains its connection from that very direct perception, undermine that very [direct perception]?

original: 'on te mngon sum du grub pa'i don la gnod par mi byed na ni de'i tshe dngos por smra ba rnams legs par gnas pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum du grub pa'i don la gnod par mi byed na ni de'i tshe dngos por smra ba rnams legs par gnas pa kho na yin te /
translated: But if it does not undermine the object established by direct perception, then at that time the proponents of real entities are well-founded,

original: thob par bya ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob par bya ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because what is to be attained has been attained.

original: gzhan yang gal te chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du 'grub par bya ba'i phyir gtan tshigs yod pa'i chos shig ston na ni de'i tshe de las bzlog pa bsgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du 'grub par bya ba'i phyir gtan tshigs yod pa'i chos shig ston na ni de'i tshe de las bzlog pa bsgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, if an existent property is taught as a reason in order to establish that all phenomena are essenceless, then, since it would be the opposite of that, the reason would be contradictory.

original: 'on te med pa'i chos shig yin na ni de'i tshe med pa dang dngos po med par lhan cig phan tshun 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar na sgrub pa nyid yin /
analyzed: 'on te med pa'i chos shig yin na ni de'i tshe med pa dang dngos po med par lhan cig phan tshun 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar na sgrub pa nyid yin /
translated: But if a nonexistent property is taught as a reason, then since nonexistence and nonentity do not mutually relate, how could it be established?

original: ji ste gnyi ga'i chos shig yin na ni de yang nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ste gnyi ga'i chos shig yin na ni de yang nges pa ma yin te /
translated: But if a property of both is taught as a reason, then that also is not ascertained,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists even in the discordant side.

original: gang las de 'grub par 'gyur ba'i tshad ma gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang las de 'grub par 'gyur ba'i tshad ma gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And there is no other valid cognition from which that could be established.

original: de ni tshig tsam gyis kyang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de ni tshig tsam gyis kyang mi 'grub ste /
translated: That is not established even by mere words,

original: thams cad kyis thams cad 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyis thams cad 'grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that everything would be established by everything.

original: tshig kyang 'gal te ngo bo nyid med pa yin na ni ji ltar de grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: tshig kyang 'gal te ngo bo nyid med pa yin na ni ji ltar de grub par 'gyur /
translated: Also, the words are contradictory: if they are essenceless, how could they be established?

original: thal bar bsgrubs pas kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: thal bar bsgrubs pas kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub ste /
translated: Also, the meaning that is intended is not established by the reductio,

original: de lta bu'i thal ba nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i thal ba nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reductio itself is not established.

original: thal bar sgrub pa'i sgo nas ni gzhan gyi phyogs la gnod pa tsam du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: thal bar sgrub pa'i sgo nas ni gzhan gyi phyogs la gnod pa tsam du 'gyur gyi /
translated: By means of the reductio, one merely refutes the position of the other;

original: rang gi phyogs 'grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi phyogs 'grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: one does not establish one‚Äôs own position,

original: de ni gnyi ga la grub pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gnyi ga la grub pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the establishment of that depends on another argument accepted by both parties.

original: gang yang dngos po rnams ni rang las mi skye ste /
analyzed: gang yang dngos po rnams ni rang las mi skye ste /
translated: Things do not arise from themselves,

original: ma skyes pa rnams ni med pas gang du yang rgyu nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa rnams ni med pas gang du yang rgyu nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which has arisen does not arise again, and that which has not arisen does not arise.

original: skyes zin pa rnams kyang yang bdag nyid bskyed pa don med de /
analyzed: skyes zin pa rnams kyang yang bdag nyid bskyed pa don med de /
translated: That which has arisen does not arise again, because it already exists.

original: grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which has not arisen does not arise, because it does not exist.

original: bye brag med pa yin na ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por yang rigs pa ma @137a * //
analyzed: bye brag med pa yin na ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por yang rigs pa ma @137a * //
translated: If there were no distinction, it would not be tenable for anything to be a cause.

original: yin te / de'i rgyu ni bye brag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin te / de'i rgyu ni bye brag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its cause is a particular.

original: dngos po rnams gzhan las kyang mi skye ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams gzhan las kyang mi skye ste /
translated: Things do not arise from other,

original: gzhan nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang re zhig gzhan du gyur pa rtag pa las kyang 'di dag mi skye ste /
analyzed: gzhan nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang re zhig gzhan du gyur pa rtag pa las kyang 'di dag mi skye ste /
translated: because otherness is not established.

original: rtag pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, things do not arise from a permanent other, because it is contradictory for a permanent thing to function sequentially or simultaneously.

original: mi rtag pa las kyang re zhig zhig pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa las kyang re zhig zhig pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: Things do not arise from an impermanent other, because things do not arise from a thing that is already disintegrated.

original: de ni de'i tshe med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i tshe med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, the other does not exist.

original: ma zhig pa las kyang ma yin to //
analyzed: ma zhig pa las kyang ma yin to //
translated: Nor do things arise from a thing that is not disintegrated,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag mnyam pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag mnyam pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that cause and effect would be simultaneous.

original: dus mnyam par 'byung ba dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dus mnyam par 'byung ba dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical for things that occur simultaneously to be cause and effect,

original: grub zin pa'i gnas skabs na gnyi ga yang grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas phan tshun phan 'dogs par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub zin pa'i gnas skabs na gnyi ga yang grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas phan tshun phan 'dogs par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when the state of being established is complete, both have the nature of being established, and thus they do not mutually benefit each other.

original: ma grub pa'i gnas skabs na ni gnyi ga yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma grub pa'i gnas skabs na ni gnyi ga yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when they are not established, neither of them exists.

original: ha cang phan 'dogs par mi byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: ha cang phan 'dogs par mi byed pa nyid do //
translated: It is not that they are not helpful,

original: gnyi ga las kyang mi skye ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga las kyang mi skye ste /
translated: nor do they arise from both,

original: ji skad bshad pa'i skyon gnyi gar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gcig la gnyis nyid 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i skyon gnyi gar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gcig la gnyis nyid 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the error of both arising would ensue, as previously explained, and because it is contradictory for one thing to be two.

original: dngos po rnams ni rgyu med pa nyid du 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni rgyu med pa nyid du 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Things do not arise without a cause,üîΩbecause they are seen to be intermittent.

original: res 'ga' ba nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ba nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not reasonable, because

original: 'di ltar rang las ma yin ;üîΩgnyi ga las ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang las ma yin ; gnyi ga las ma yin /
translated: things do not arise from themselves,üîΩnor from another,üîΩnor from both,

original: rgyu zhig pa las kyang ma yin /
analyzed: rgyu zhig pa las kyang ma yin /
translated: nor from a destroyed cause,

original: rgyu med pa las kyang ma yin /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las kyang ma yin /
translated: nor without a cause.

original: rgyu rtag par 'dod pa las kyang 'bras bu mi skye'o zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs na /
analyzed: rgyu rtag par 'dod pa las kyang 'bras bu mi skye'o zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs na /
translated: It is reasonable to say that an effect does not arise from a permanent cause that is held to be a cause.

original: rgyu gzhan mi rtag par 'dod pa ma zhig pa las 'bras bu skye ba la go 'gal ba ci zhig yod na gang gi phyir de las 'bras bu skye ba yang dgag /'di la ni gnod pa byed pa'i tshad ma yang cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan mi rtag par 'dod pa ma zhig pa las 'bras bu skye ba la go 'gal ba ci zhig yod na gang gi phyir de las 'bras bu skye ba yang dgag /'di la ni gnod pa byed pa'i tshad ma yang cung zad kyang med do //
translated: What contradiction is there in the effect arising from the cause that has not yet ceased? Why is the arising of the effect from that cause being refuted? And there is not the slightest valid cognition that contradicts this.

original: gzhan du gyur pa dngos po tsam yang mi 'grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa dngos po tsam yang mi 'grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that the mere thing that is transformed is not established.

original: 'di ltar gang gi mjug thogs su 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba de nyid gzhan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi mjug thogs su 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba de nyid gzhan zhes bya'o //
translated: For that which is transformed is called ‚Äúother‚Äù because the effect arises immediately after it.

original: 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol du de la gzhan zhes bya ba ma grub tu zin kyang dngos po la ni nyams pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba'i sngon rol du de la gzhan zhes bya ba ma grub tu zin kyang dngos po la ni nyams pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Even though prior to the arising of the effect, that which is called ‚Äúother‚Äù is not established, the thing itself is not damaged.

original: kha cig gis gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes gnod pa can gyi tshad ma smras pa gang yin pa de yang ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig gis gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes gnod pa can gyi tshad ma smras pa gang yin pa de yang ma nges pa yin te /
translated: Some say that the valid cognition that contradicts this is ‚Äúbecause it is other.‚Äù But that is not certain.

original: gzhan nyid dang skyed par byed par 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid dang skyed par byed par 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no contradiction between being other and being a producer.

original: mi 'gal ba'i tshul de ni dgag @137b par nus pa yang ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'gal ba'i tshul de ni dgag @137b par nus pa yang ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not possible to refute that mode of non- contradiction, because it would lead to absurdity.

original: de lta na ni gzhan 'ga' zhig la dbul ba nyid dang / blun pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos mthong bas gzhan nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi 'gro ba thams cad dbul ba la sogs pa'i chos nye bar len par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni gzhan 'ga' zhig la dbul ba nyid dang / blun pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos mthong bas gzhan nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi 'gro ba thams cad dbul ba la sogs pa'i chos nye bar len par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then seeing the attributes of poverty, stupidity, and so on in some other person, the reason of otherness would entail that all beings would appropriate the attributes of poverty and so on.

original: 'on te gzhan ma zhig pa ma chod pa las 'bras bu skye na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus mnyam pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no snyam du sems na de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan ma zhig pa ma chod pa las 'bras bu skye na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus mnyam pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no snyam du sems na de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But if you think that the effect arises from the non-disintegrated cause that is not obstructed, then the effect and cause would be simultaneous. The valid cognition that is the refutation of that is the absurd consequence. That is not logical.

original: mchod par 'bras bu skye yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus mnyam pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mchod par 'bras bu skye yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus mnyam pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even though the effect arises from the cause, the effect and cause are not simultaneous.

original: skad cig ma nyid kyis 'bras bu yod pa'i dus na rgyu mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid kyis 'bras bu yod pa'i dus na rgyu mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause does not endure when the effect exists, since it is momentary.

original: gang gi tshe 'bras bu yod par gyur pa de nyid kyi tshe rgyu 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'bras bu yod par gyur pa de nyid kyi tshe rgyu 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: When the effect exists, at that time the cause ceases.

original: srang mda'i mthon dman bzhin pas dus mnyam pa nyid du lta thal bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: srang mda'i mthon dman bzhin pas dus mnyam pa nyid du lta thal bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could it be tenable that they are simultaneous, like the ascending and descending of a scale?

original: des na rgyu gnas su zin kyang de'i tshe 'bras bu grub zin pa'i phyir don med pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na rgyu gnas su zin kyang de'i tshe 'bras bu grub zin pa'i phyir don med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, even if the cause endures, since the effect would already be established at that time, it would be pointless.

original: gzhan yang dper na dngos po zhig nas med pa mchod par skad cig ma gnyis pa la gzhag par bya ba dngos po dang lhan cig dus gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba ltar 'bras bu yang de dang 'dra bas mi 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan yang dper na dngos po zhig nas med pa mchod par skad cig ma gnyis pa la gzhag par bya ba dngos po dang lhan cig dus gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba ltar 'bras bu yang de dang 'dra bas mi 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: Moreover, just as a thing that has been destroyed and is nonexistent in the second moment is not placed together with the thing in the second moment, the effect is also like that.

original: dper na grib ma dang nyi ma dag dang 'bab chu'i rgyun dag la chu'i rgyun snga phyi dag mchod kyang yul gcig pa nyid ma yin pa ltar 'di la yang de dang 'dra bas dus gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na grib ma dang nyi ma dag dang 'bab chu'i rgyun dag la chu'i rgyun snga phyi dag mchod kyang yul gcig pa nyid ma yin pa ltar 'di la yang de dang 'dra bas dus gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, just as the earlier and later parts of a stream of water are not in the same place, even though they are placed together, the same would not be true of this.

original: gzhan dngos por gyur pa khas mi len pa'i phyir gtan tshigs cig shos la ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dngos por gyur pa khas mi len pa'i phyir gtan tshigs cig shos la ma grub pa yin no //
translated: The other reason is not established for the opponent, because he does not accept that the effect is an existent thing.

original: gang yang 'bras bu yod pa yang mi skye ste /
analyzed: gang yang 'bras bu yod pa yang mi skye ste /
translated: Also, it is not correct to say that an existent effect does not arise,

original: skye ba don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its arising would be pointless.

original: med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does a nonexistent arise,

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: because it would follow that even a rabbit‚Äôs horns would arise.

original: 'bras bu yod pa skye ba dgag na khyed la gnyi ga la grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe med de /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa skye ba dgag na khyed la gnyi ga la grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang dpe med de /
translated: If you refute the arising of an existent effect, you have no reason or example that is established for both parties.

original: grub na ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du dam bcas pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grub na ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du dam bcas pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do have such a reason, then your thesis that things are essenceless is undermined.

original: grangs can la sogs pas kun brtags pa'i 'bras bu yod par smra ba mi rung du chug na yang /
analyzed: grangs can la sogs pas kun brtags pa'i 'bras bu yod par smra ba mi rung du chug na yang /
translated: Even if it is not possible to say that the effect is existent, as the SƒÅ·πÉkhya and so on imagine,

original: 'bras bu med pa skye ba la go 'gal ba ci zhig yod na gang gis na 'di yang dgag / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang skye bar thal bar yang mi @138a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa skye ba la go 'gal ba ci zhig yod na gang gis na 'di yang dgag / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang skye bar thal bar yang mi @138a * //
translated: what contradiction is there in saying that an effect arises that is nonexistent? What is there that prevents you from refuting that? It would follow, absurdly, that even a rabbit‚Äôs horns would arise.

original: 'gyur te / de dag la de lta bu'i rgyu med pa'i phyir mi skye ba yin gyi med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur te / de dag la de lta bu'i rgyu med pa'i phyir mi skye ba yin gyi med pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: because they do not arise due to the absence of such a cause, not due to the absence of non-arising.

original: thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: And it does not follow that everything arises from everything,

original: rgyu'i nus pa so sor nges pa'i sgo nas rnam par gnas pa nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i nus pa so sor nges pa'i sgo nas rnam par gnas pa nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the power of the cause is restricted in terms of its specific determination.

original: rgyu'i nus pa so sor nges pa yang gdon mi za bar khas blang dgos te /üîΩde lta ma yin na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po kun rdzob pa la yang ci'i phyir thams cad las thams cad skye bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu'i nus pa so sor nges pa yang gdon mi za bar khas blang dgos te / de lta ma yin na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po kun rdzob pa la yang ci'i phyir thams cad las thams cad skye bar mi 'gyur /
translated: And the specific determination of the power of the cause must be accepted without doubt,üîΩotherwise, why would everything not arise from everything even in the conventional sense of cause and effect?

original: gzhan yang gal te zhig pa dang ma zhig pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa don dam pa pa'i skye ba la gnod pa byed na kun rdzob pa la yang ci'i phyir gnod pa mi byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te zhig pa dang ma zhig pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa don dam pa pa'i skye ba la gnod pa byed na kun rdzob pa la yang ci'i phyir gnod pa mi byed de /
translated: Moreover, if the conceptions of destruction and nondestruction, etc., invalidate ultimate arising, why do they not invalidate the conventional?

original: dngos po'i stobs las 'ongs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi yul ni skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis rnam par dbye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs las 'ongs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi yul ni skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i dbang gis rnam par dbye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not right to divide the domain of a reason that comes from the power of things according to the power of a person‚Äôs desire.

original: 'on te mngon sum gyis gnod par dogs pas de la gtan tshigs mi 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum gyis gnod par dogs pas de la gtan tshigs mi 'jug go zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the reason does not apply to that because it is feared that it would be contradicted by perception,

original: 'o na ni 'di gtan tshigs ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'di gtan tshigs ma yin te /
translated: then it is not a reason,

original: gnod par byar rung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgang dag rgyu gcig las kyang 'bras bu du ma skye bar rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gnod par byar rung ba'i phyir ro // gang dag rgyu gcig las kyang 'bras bu du ma skye bar rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: because it is suitable to be contradicted.üîΩIt is not right that many effects arise from a single cause,

original: du ma las kyang gcig skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: du ma las kyang gcig skye bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: nor is it right that a single effect arises from many causes.

original: gzhan du na rgyu'i tha dad pa nyid kyis tha dad par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na rgyu'i tha dad pa nyid kyis tha dad par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the difference would not be made by the difference of the causes.

original: de nyid kyi phyir du ma las kyang 'bras bu du ma mi skye ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir du ma las kyang 'bras bu du ma mi skye ste /
translated: For that very reason, many effects do not arise from many causes.

original: 'di ltar gal te 'bras bu re re la rgyu thams cad kyis byed na ni de'i tshe rgyu tha dad pa de nyid tha dad par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te 'bras bu re re la rgyu thams cad kyis byed na ni de'i tshe rgyu tha dad pa de nyid tha dad par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, if each effect is produced by all the causes, then the difference of the causes would not make a difference.

original: du ma las re re zhig skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ma las re re zhig skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because a single effect arises from many causes.

original: 'on te re re la mi byed na ni de'i tshe ji ltar du ma las du ma skye ba yin /
analyzed: 'on te re re la mi byed na ni de'i tshe ji ltar du ma las du ma skye ba yin /
translated: But if you do not accept that a single cause produces a single effect, then how can you say that many causes produce many effects?

original: gcig las gcig skye ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig las gcig skye ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that a single effect arises from a single cause,

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dag las de'i rnam par shes pa skye'i de'i tshe rang gi rigs ma thun pa'i skad cig ma mi skye na thams cad long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de yang rigs pa
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dag las de'i rnam par shes pa skye'i de'i tshe rang gi rigs ma thun pa'i skad cig ma mi skye na thams cad long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de yang rigs pa
translated: because the eye consciousness and so on arise from the eye faculty and so on, but not from a moment of a homogeneous cause of its own type, because it would follow that everyone would be blind, deaf, and so on.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: 'di ltar re zhig long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur ba gleng ba gang yin pa de khas mi len pa'i phyir mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig long ba dang 'on pa la sogs pa'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur ba gleng ba gang yin pa de khas mi len pa'i phyir mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: Because we do not accept that it follows that everyone would be blind, deaf, and so on, it is impossible.

original: thams cad tshogs pa kho na las skye ba'i phyir gcig las gcig skye ba ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: thams cad tshogs pa kho na las skye ba'i phyir gcig las gcig skye ba ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Because an effect arises from the assembly of all causes, not even a single effect arises from a single cause.

original: @138b gang gis na gcig las du ma skye ba dang / du ma las gcig skye ba 'gal bar 'gyur ba rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo yang 'phos nas skyed par byed pa nyid du mi 'dod mod kyi /
analyzed: @138b gang gis na gcig las du ma skye ba dang / du ma las gcig skye ba 'gal bar 'gyur ba rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo yang 'phos nas skyed par byed pa nyid du mi 'dod mod kyi /
translated: But although we do not accept that the cause itself is transferred and produces the effect,

original: 'on kyang mar me la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo du ma can yod pa tsam gyis 'bras bu rang gi ngo bo du ma can skyed pa mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang mar me la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo du ma can yod pa tsam gyis 'bras bu rang gi ngo bo du ma can skyed pa mthong ba nyid do //
translated: we do see that the mere existence of a cause that has a multiple nature produces an effect that has a multiple nature, as in the case of a flame.

original: rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa ma yin par thal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa ma yin par thal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor does it follow that the difference in the effect is not due to a difference in the cause,

original: rgyu'i bye brag las 'bras bu'i bye brag skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i bye brag las 'bras bu'i bye brag skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the difference in the effect is due to a difference in the cause.

original: rgyu'i bye brag las 'bras bu'i bye brag skye'o zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di kho na rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i bye brag las 'bras bu'i bye brag skye'o zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di kho na rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: The difference in the effect is due to a difference in the cause. This alone is the difference in the cause that produces the difference in the effect.

original: gang yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyis zhi ba'o zhes zer ba gang yin pa de yang 'di'i ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid kyis zhi ba'o zhes zer ba gang yin pa de yang 'di'i ma nges pa yin te /
translated: And whatever is dependently arisen is by nature peaceful.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid dang / ngo bo nyid dang bcas par lhan cig 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid dang / ngo bo nyid dang bcas par lhan cig 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is also inconclusive for you, because there is no contradiction in something being dependently arisen and also having an intrinsic reality.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid du grags pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid du grags pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba nyid kyang yin te /
translated: The reason is contradictory, because it is well known that dependent origination is intrinsic reality.

original: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa ma skyes pa rnams ni ngo bo nyid dang bcas par nyams su myong ba med do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa ma skyes pa rnams ni ngo bo nyid dang bcas par nyams su myong ba med do //
translated: Unproduced things such as sky flowers do not have intrinsic reality.

original: gal te dngos po rnams don dam par ngo bo nyid dang bcas par ma gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di dag kun rdzob tu yang ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams don dam par ngo bo nyid dang bcas par ma gyur na ni de'i tshe 'di dag kun rdzob tu yang ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If things did not have intrinsic reality ultimately, then they would not have intrinsic reality even conventionally.

original: gang dag don dam par med pa de dag ni kun rdzob tu yang ngo bo nyid du mi skye bar mthong ste /
analyzed: gang dag don dam par med pa de dag ni kun rdzob tu yang ngo bo nyid du mi skye bar mthong ste /
translated: Those that do not exist ultimately do not arise inherently even conventionally,

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
translated: like the son of a barren woman.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du mtshungs na ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa snang ba de bzhin du ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang ci'i phyir snang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du mtshungs na ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa snang ba de bzhin du ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang ci'i phyir snang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If they are similar in being essenceless, why is it that form, etc. appear, but the horns of a donkey, etc. do not appear?

original: snang ba'i bye brag nges pa 'di la rgyu ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: snang ba'i bye brag nges pa 'di la rgyu ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is no cause at all for the certainty of the distinction in appearance.

original: gang dag dngos po thams cad ni gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir rang bzhin med pa'o zhes zer ba de la yang gal te thal bar sgrub na ni de'i tshe gzhan dag de lta bu khas mi len pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa
analyzed: gang dag dngos po thams cad ni gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir rang bzhin med pa'o zhes zer ba de la yang gal te thal bar sgrub na ni de'i tshe gzhan dag de lta bu khas mi len pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa
translated: If you argue that all things are essenceless because they are devoid of the nature of being one or many, then if you are reductio, then the reason is not established, because others do not accept that.

original: yin te / gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i dngos po ni su yang khas mi len to //
analyzed: yin te / gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i dngos po ni su yang khas mi len to //
translated: No one accepts that things are devoid of the nature of being one or many.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang dgar sgrub na yang gtan tshigs cig shos la ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang dgar sgrub na yang gtan tshigs cig shos la ma grub pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, even if one were to prove it by one‚Äôs own choice, the other reason would not be established.

original: de lta bu'i chos can bdag nyid la ma grub pa'i phyir gzhi ma grub pa yang yin la /üîΩmi @139a * //
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos can bdag nyid la ma grub pa'i phyir gzhi ma grub pa yang yin la / mi @139a * //
translated: Because such a subject is not established for oneself, it is also not established as a basis.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir ma nges pa yang yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i phyir ma nges pa yang yin no //
translated: Because there is doubt about the reversal of the discordant factor, it is also indefinite.

original: gzhan yang 'di la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa dag ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid dam /üîΩmed pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig tu 'gyur grang na /üîΩgal te ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni de'i tshe gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i dngos po'i ngo bor khas blangs par gyur pas de yang mi 'dod par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di la bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa dag ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid dam / med pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig tu 'gyur grang na / gal te ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni de'i tshe gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i dngos po'i ngo bor khas blangs par gyur pas de yang mi 'dod par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, in this case, the probandum and the proof would become either essentially non-existent or essentially existent.üîΩIf they were essentially non-existent, then at that time, one would accept that the nature of entities is free from the nature of singularity and multiplicity, and that would not be accepted.

original: 'on te med pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig yin na ni de'i tshe rtogs par bya ba dang / rtogs par byed pa'i dngos por mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te med pa'i ngo bo nyid gcig yin na ni de'i tshe rtogs par bya ba dang / rtogs par byed pa'i dngos por mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if they were essentially existent, then at that time, the object of understanding and the means of understanding would not be possible, because the object of understanding and the means of understanding would be essentially non-different.

original: gnyi ga yang ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dang / phan tshun 'brel pa med pa'i phyir dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dang / phan tshun 'brel pa med pa'i phyir dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are devoid of intrinsic reality, because they are not mutually related, and because they are not different.

original: gang zhig nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid de ni cung zad kyang go bar mi byed cing /
analyzed: gang zhig nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid de ni cung zad kyang go bar mi byed cing /
translated: That which is devoid of all verbal expression has no characteristic at all, and it does not cause understanding.

original: go bar bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: go bar bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it to be understood,

original: dper na rta'i rva lta bu yin la /
analyzed: dper na rta'i rva lta bu yin la /
translated: just like the horn of an ass.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa dag kyang nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa dag kyang nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The probandum and the probans, as they have been explained, are also devoid of all verbal expression.

original: gang dag phan chun ma 'brel pa de dag ni go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dag phan chun ma 'brel pa de dag ni go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po ma yin te /
translated: Those that are not mutually related are not the entities of that which is to be understood and that which causes understanding,

original: dper na ri 'bigs byed dang gangs can dag lta bu yin la /
analyzed: dper na ri 'bigs byed dang gangs can dag lta bu yin la /
translated: just like the Vindhya and the Himalaya mountains.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa dag kyang phan tshun ma 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa dag kyang phan tshun ma 'brel pa yin no //
translated: The probandum and the probans are not mutually related.

original: ci ste gnyi ga yang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa kho na'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ci ste gnyi ga yang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa yod pa kho na'o snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that because both are essentially unreal, the relation of identity exists,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not reasonable.

original: de'i bdag nyid ni dngos po kho na la rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni dngos po kho na la rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For identity is restricted to real things alone.

original: gang zhig gang las tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de dag la ni go bar bya ba dang / go bar byed pa'i dngos po med de /
analyzed: gang zhig gang las tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de dag la ni go bar bya ba dang / go bar byed pa'i dngos po med de /
translated: And those things that do not have a different nature from something else cannot be the referent and the referent of an expression,

original: dper na shing dang ljon pa dag lta bu yin la /
analyzed: dper na shing dang ljon pa dag lta bu yin la /
translated: like a tree and a shala tree.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa dag kyang tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //üîΩbyas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid dag gis ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa dag kyang tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no // byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid dag gis ma nges pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: And the probandum and the proof, as they have been explained, do not have a different nature.

original: de la ni ldog pas byas pa'i bye brag yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni ldog pas byas pa'i bye brag yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is there the fault of overextension, because there is a difference in the exclusion in that case.

original: gal te 'di la yang ldog pas byas pa'i bye brag yod pa kho na'o snyam du sems na de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'di la yang ldog pas byas pa'i bye brag yod pa kho na'o snyam du sems na de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If you think that there is only a difference in the negation, that is not logical.

original: de lta na ni sngon po dang ser po dag bzhin du de dag dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni sngon po dang ser po dag bzhin du de dag dngos po nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, they would be things, like blue and yellow.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral @139b ba'i gtan tshigs 'di nyid kyis dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa de bzhin du chos can yang dngos po med par sgrub na ni chos can las bzlog pa
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral @139b ba'i gtan tshigs 'di nyid kyis dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa de bzhin du chos can yang dngos po med par sgrub na ni chos can las bzlog pa
translated: Moreover, just as this argument that they are devoid of the nature of unity and multiplicity establishes that things are essenceless, in the same way, if the subject were established as essenceless, then,

original: sgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'gal ba yin te /
translated: because the argument would establish the opposite of the subject, it would be contradictory.

original: de ltar na ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgrub pa la tshad ma ci yang med do //
analyzed: de ltar na ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgrub pa la tshad ma ci yang med do //
translated: In that case, there would be no valid cognition at all that establishes essencelessness.

original: gzhan yang gal te rnam par shes pa yang chos gzhan bzhin du don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa yin na ni de'i tshe de yang brdzun pa yin pa'i phyir rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis de'i chos gzhan bzhin du spong bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te rnam par shes pa yang chos gzhan bzhin du don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa yin na ni de'i tshe de yang brdzun pa yin pa'i phyir rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis de'i chos gzhan bzhin du spong bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if consciousness, like other things, is ultimately essenceless, then it would be false, and therefore, like other things, it would be abandoned by yogis.

original: de byed na ni rnal 'byor pa yang med /
analyzed: de byed na ni rnal 'byor pa yang med /
translated: If it were abandoned, there would be no yogis.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa yang med /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa yang med /
translated: There would be no consciousness of yogis.

original: des de kho na nyid so sor rig pa yang med /
analyzed: des de kho na nyid so sor rig pa yang med /
translated: There would be no discernment of reality by that.

original: des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yang med /
analyzed: des sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yang med /
translated: There would be no nonabiding nirvana of the Bhagavan Buddhas.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa yang med de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa yang med de /
translated: There would be no omniscience.

original: de'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa thams cad rab tu bshig pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par gzhag pa thams cad rab tu bshig pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all principles would be utterly destroyed.

original: kun rdzob tu rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa la sogs pa khas blangs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyang phyin ci log dang ldan par thal bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa la sogs pa khas blangs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyang phyin ci log dang ldan par thal bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And because the Buddhas accept the consciousness of yogis and so forth conventionally, it would follow, absurdly, that they would be mistaken.

original: gzhan yang khyed kyi chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par dam bcas pa 'di ni rigs pa dang lung la sogs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed kyi chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par dam bcas pa 'di ni rigs pa dang lung la sogs pa dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, your thesis that all phenomena are devoid of entityness contradicts reasoning, scripture, and so on.

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa yul dang dus kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis gsal ba kho nar snang ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid du nges pas re zhig dang por mngon sum dang 'gal ba 'jug par gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa yul dang dus kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis gsal ba kho nar snang ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid du nges pas re zhig dang por mngon sum dang 'gal ba 'jug par gsal ba nyid do //
translated: Because form and so on are clearly seen to be differentiated by way of place, time, and occasion, they are ascertained to possess entityness. Thus, first, your thesis contradicts direct perception.

original: me la sogs pa'i dngos po gang dag lkog tu gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dod pa de dag kyang der 'khrul pa med pa'i rtags du ba la sogs pa nges pa las byung ba'i tshad ma rjes su dpag pas yang dag par grub pa'i bdag nyid kyi
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i dngos po gang dag lkog tu gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dod pa de dag kyang der 'khrul pa med pa'i rtags du ba la sogs pa nges pa las byung ba'i tshad ma rjes su dpag pas yang dag par grub pa'i bdag nyid kyi
translated: Those things such as fire that are asserted to have a hidden essence are established by valid inferential cognition that arises from a sign that is incontrovertible in regard to that object.

original: ngo bo kho na'o //
analyzed: ngo bo kho na'o //
translated: The essence of those things is only that which is established by valid cognition.

original: dngos po rnams kyi skye ba yang res 'ga' ba nyid kyis rgyu dang rkyen la ltos par grags te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi skye ba yang res 'ga' ba nyid kyis rgyu dang rkyen la ltos par grags te /
translated: The arising of things is also renowned as relying on causes and conditions because it is intermittent.

original: rgyu med pa ni ltos pa med pas res 'ga' ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa ni ltos pa med pas res 'ga' ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is causeless is not tenable as occasional, since it is not dependent.

original: de'i phyir dam bcas pa la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dam bcas pa la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yang yin no //
translated: Therefore, the thesis is also undermined by inference.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i grong khyer la sogs pa shin tu lkog tu gyur pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang 'jig rten mtha' dag gi mig gcig tu gyur pa skyob pa @140a * //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i grong khyer la sogs pa shin tu lkog tu gyur pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang 'jig rten mtha' dag gi mig gcig tu gyur pa skyob pa @140a * //
translated: The city of the Thirty-Three Gods and so on are extremely hidden, but the Protector, who is the sole eye of the entire world,

original: bdag nyid kyi ye shes kyi spyan sgrib pa mi mnga' bas mngon sum du gzigs te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi ye shes kyi spyan sgrib pa mi mnga' bas mngon sum du gzigs te /
translated: directly perceives them with the eye of his unobstructed wisdom and teaches them to others.

original: gzhan dag la yang bstan pa'i phyir yod par yid ches pa'i lung gi sgo nas yang dag par grub pas lung dang 'gal ba yang yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang bstan pa'i phyir yod par yid ches pa'i lung gi sgo nas yang dag par grub pas lung dang 'gal ba yang yin te /
translated: Therefore, the thesis is also undermined by scripture, since it is established by the valid cognition of scripture that they exist.

original: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa med pa dag la ni de ltar gzigs pa dang bstan pa 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa med pa dag la ni de ltar gzigs pa dang bstan pa 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not tenable that nonexistent things such as sky flowers are perceived and taught in that way.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam pa du mar bstan pa gang yin pa de yang 'di dag ngo bo nyid med na ji ltar rung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam pa du mar bstan pa gang yin pa de yang 'di dag ngo bo nyid med na ji ltar rung ste /
translated: The Lord has taught the dependent origination of internal and external things in many ways. But if they are essenceless, how could that be?

original: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa shin tu med pa rnams ni gtan nas skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa shin tu med pa rnams ni gtan nas skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Things that are utterly nonexistent, like sky- lotuses, are never produced.

original: las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu de nyid kyis lha dang dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar gyur pa gang dag rang byung nyid kyis yang dag par bstan pa de dag dang yang ji ltar 'gal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: las dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu de nyid kyis lha dang dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar gyur pa gang dag rang byung nyid kyis yang dag par bstan pa de dag dang yang ji ltar 'gal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: How could it not contradict the fact that the fruits of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions are the causes of the transmigrations of gods, hell- beings, and so forth, which the TathƒÅgata himself has taught?

original: rus sbal gyi sbu la sogs pa shin tu med pa rnams las gos bya bar bstan pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rus sbal gyi sbu la sogs pa shin tu med pa rnams las gos bya bar bstan pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to teach that cloth can be made from the hairs of a tortoise, which are utterly nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir las kyi 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba la skur pa btab pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs la skur ba btab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir las kyi 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba la skur pa btab pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs la skur ba btab par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since he repudiates the pleasant and unpleasant results of karma, he repudiates the side of affliction.

original: mdo la sogs pa las 'phags pa rnams kyis lam bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis gong nas gong du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'bras bu rtogs par rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa der yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mdo la sogs pa las 'phags pa rnams kyis lam bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis gong nas gong du 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'bras bu rtogs par rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa der yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: And also, the presentation of the ƒÅryas‚Äô realization of higher and higher fruits through the power of cultivating the path in the s≈´tras and so on would not exist,

original: rtogs pa dang / rtogs par bya ba dang / rtogs par byed pa rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang / rtogs par bya ba dang / rtogs par byed pa rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no realization, no object of realization, and no one who realizes.

original: ri bong gi rva las byas pa'i them skas kyi lam la mo gsham gyi bu'i rkang pa bzhag nas rta'i rva las byas pa'i ka ba'i tshogs btsugs pa'i khang bzangs rgya che zhing rab tu mtho ba'i steng du 'dzeg pa ni med de /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva las byas pa'i them skas kyi lam la mo gsham gyi bu'i rkang pa bzhag nas rta'i rva las byas pa'i ka ba'i tshogs btsugs pa'i khang bzangs rgya che zhing rab tu mtho ba'i steng du 'dzeg pa ni med de /
translated: A barren woman‚Äôs son cannot ascend a mansion that is very large and very high, with a staircase made of rabbit horns, supported by pillars made of horse hair.

original: de'i phyir rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la skur pa btab pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la skur pa btab pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, you have the fault of deprecating the factor of purification.

original: de ltar khyed kyi phyogs gnyi ga la skur pa btab na bden pa bzhi bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar khyed kyi phyogs gnyi ga la skur pa btab na bden pa bzhi bkag pa yin no //
translated: Thus, since you deprecate both of your own and others‚Äô positions, you have refuted the four noble truths.

original: sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin par gnag rji'i chung ma yan chad la grags pas dam bcas pa la grags pas gnod pa yang yin no //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu la sogs pa bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed par byed pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin par gnag rji'i chung ma yan chad la grags pas dam bcas pa la grags pas gnod pa yang yin no //
translated: Since the nature of the things that are produced, such as the seed and sprout, and the things that produce them is renowned even to the wife of a plowman, your thesis is undermined by what is commonly seen.

original: @140b gtan tshigs sbyor bar 'dod pas gzhan dag nges pa skyed par 'dod pa nyid kyis de las nges pa skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yang yin no //
analyzed: @140b gtan tshigs sbyor bar 'dod pas gzhan dag nges pa skyed par 'dod pa nyid kyis de las nges pa skye bar khas blangs pa'i phyir rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yang yin no //
translated: Since you who wish to employ the syllogism wish to generate certainty in others, you have accepted that certainty arises from that. Therefore, you have a contradiction with your own words.

original: gang yang bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma'i sgo nas dngos po rnams yod pa nyid du bstan pa de la yang gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang yang bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma'i sgo nas dngos po rnams yod pa nyid du bstan pa de la yang gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the BhagavƒÅn himself taught that things exist through the means of direct perception and so on. That also is undermined.

original: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas sngon po shes kyi sngon po'o snyam du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngon po la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams mngon sum gyi tshad ma rtogs pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyis rtogsüîΩpa yin no zhes bya ba rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas sngon po shes kyi sngon po'o snyam du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngon po la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams mngon sum gyi tshad ma rtogs pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyis rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba rab tu bstan to //
translated: Thus, it is taught that things such as blue are perceived by the valid knowledge of direct perception, which is characterized by being free from conceptuality, by such statements as ‚ÄúThe eye consciousness knows blue, but does not think ‚ÄòThis is blue.‚Äô‚ÄùüîΩIt is taught that things such as blue are perceived by the valid knowledge of direct perception, which is characterized by being free from conceptuality, by such statements as ‚ÄúThe eye consciousness knows blue, but does not think ‚ÄòThis is blue.‚Äô‚Äù

original: nam mkha'i autpala la yod pa'i sngon po la sogs pa ni mig gi sems kyis nyams su myong ba med do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i autpala la yod pa'i sngon po la sogs pa ni mig gi sems kyis nyams su myong ba med do //
translated: The blue, etc., that exist in a sky-lotus are not experienced by the eye consciousness.

original: gang cung zad skye ba'i chos can yin pa de thams cad ni 'gog pa'i chos can yin no zhes bya ba 'dis gtan tshigs la bsgrub par bya bas khyab pas nye bar ston pa mdzad pas dngos po rnams rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas rab tu grub pa'i
analyzed: gang cung zad skye ba'i chos can yin pa de thams cad ni 'gog pa'i chos can yin no zhes bya ba 'dis gtan tshigs la bsgrub par bya bas khyab pas nye bar ston pa mdzad pas dngos po rnams rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas rab tu grub pa'i
translated: By this statement, ‚ÄúWhatever is a phenomenon that arises is necessarily a phenomenon that ceases,‚Äù he teaches the pervasion of the reason by the probandum, and thus he clearly teaches that things are established by the valid knowledge of inference

original: skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos can yin no zhes gsal bar rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos can yin no zhes gsal bar rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: to be phenomena that abide momentarily.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir de dag ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid du yang dag par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir de dag ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid du yang dag par brjod pa yin te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚ÄúThey are described as having an intrinsic reality.‚Äù

original: nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa'i shin tu med pa rnams la ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i padma la sogs pa'i shin tu med pa rnams la ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that things that are utterly nonexistent, such as a sky flower, have the qualities of arising and ceasing.

original: du ba las ni mer shes te //
analyzed: du ba las ni mer shes te //
translated: Fire is known from smoke,

original: chu skyar las ni chu yin no //
analyzed: chu skyar las ni chu yin no //
translated: and water is known from a flock of shelduck.

original: zhes me la sogs pa'i dngos po 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs las yang dag par byung ba'i nges pas nges par gzung ba'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes gsal ba kho nar rab tu bstan te /
analyzed: zhes me la sogs pa'i dngos po 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs las yang dag par byung ba'i nges pas nges par gzung ba'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes gsal ba kho nar rab tu bstan te /
translated: This clearly demonstrates that the intrinsic reality of fire and so on is ascertained by the valid knowledge that arises from the effect reason, ‚ÄúBecause smoke exists, fire exists.‚Äù

original: chu skyar la sogs pa'i rtags mthong bas smig rgyu'i chu la sogs pa med pa'i rjes su dpag par 'thad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chu skyar la sogs pa'i rtags mthong bas smig rgyu'i chu la sogs pa med pa'i rjes su dpag par 'thad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that the nonexistence of mirage water and so on is inferred from seeing the signs of a flock of shelduck and so on.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med par smra ba la chos mngon pa la sogs pa las rgyu drug dang rkyen bzhi bshad pa gang yin pa de dag kyang ji ltar rung ste bskyed par bya ba 'ga' yang med na de dag gi rgyu la sogs pa mi 'thadüîΩpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med par smra ba la chos mngon pa la sogs pa las rgyu drug dang rkyen bzhi bshad pa gang yin pa de dag kyang ji ltar rung ste bskyed par bya ba 'ga' yang med na de dag gi rgyu la sogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if nothing is produced, their causes and so on are untenable.üîΩA sutra states:

original: mdo las phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag gis chos mtha' dag yang dag par bsdus par brjod la /üîΩphung po la sogs pa de dag thams cad @141a * //
analyzed: mdo las phung po dang khams dang skye mched dag gis chos mtha' dag yang dag par bsdus par brjod la / phung po la sogs pa de dag thams cad @141a * //
translated: All phenomena are correctly subsumed by the aggregates, elements, and bases.üîΩThe Bhagavat clearly taught that all those aggregates and so on

original: kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu kho na'i ngo bor rab tu bstan na /
analyzed: kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu kho na'i ngo bor rab tu bstan na /
translated: are only the nature of causes and effects.

original: de ji ltar chos thams cad ma skyes pa yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar chos thams cad ma skyes pa yin par 'gyur /
translated: How could all phenomena be unarisen?

original: gal te phung po la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos shig mi skye bar sgrub na ni de'i tshe brtsad pa med de de las ma gtogs pa'i chos ni kho bo cag kyang khas mi len to //
analyzed: gal te phung po la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i chos shig mi skye bar sgrub na ni de'i tshe brtsad pa med de de las ma gtogs pa'i chos ni kho bo cag kyang khas mi len to //
translated: If you prove that nothing is produced apart from the aggregates and so on, then there is no dispute, because we also do not accept phenomena apart from them.

original: ji ste kun rdzob tu tshad ma la sogs pa khas len pa'i phyir sun dbyung ba 'di thams cad kyis glags mi thod do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ji ste kun rdzob tu tshad ma la sogs pa khas len pa'i phyir sun dbyung ba 'di thams cad kyis glags mi thod do snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that all of these refutations do not apply to us because we accept valid cognitions and so forth conventionally,

original: 'o na ni de'i tshe dngos po khas blangs pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i tshe dngos po khas blangs pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time you would have to accept that things exist.

original: 'di ltar tshad ma la sogs pa kun rdzob ces bya ba gang yin pa de ni gdon mi za bar nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ri bong gi rva la sogs pa las log par brjod dgos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshad ma la sogs pa kun rdzob ces bya ba gang yin pa de ni gdon mi za bar nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ri bong gi rva la sogs pa las log par brjod dgos so //
translated: This is because that which is called ‚Äúconventional‚Äù such as valid cognitions and so forth must be said to be the opposite of such things as the horns of a rabbit, which are characterized as being devoid of all expression.

original: de ltar ma yin na 'jig rten dang lung dang 'gal ba ji ltar spongs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na 'jig rten dang lung dang 'gal ba ji ltar spongs par 'gyur /
translated: If that were not so, how could you avoid contradicting the world and scripture?

original: kho bo cag ni nus pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ri bong gi rva la sogs pa las log pa gang yin pa de nyid la dngos po zhes brjod de /
analyzed: kho bo cag ni nus pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ri bong gi rva la sogs pa las log pa gang yin pa de nyid la dngos po zhes brjod de /
translated: We call that which is the opposite of such things as the horns of a rabbit, which are characterized as being devoid of all ability, ‚Äúthings.‚Äù

original: gal te khyed la yang kun rdzob tu yod do zhes ming du 'dogs na ni dga' dgur 'dogs la rag go //
analyzed: gal te khyed la yang kun rdzob tu yod do zhes ming du 'dogs na ni dga' dgur 'dogs la rag go //
translated: If you also impute the name ‚Äúconventional existence‚Äù to it, then you can impute whatever you like.

original: ming du btags pa tsam gyi sgo nas ni dngos po de lta bu'i ngo bor 'brang ba med de /
analyzed: ming du btags pa tsam gyi sgo nas ni dngos po de lta bu'i ngo bor 'brang ba med de /
translated: But there is no such entity that is to be apprehended by means of mere nominal designation.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: gzhan yang kun rdzob ces bya ba 'di yang ci yin pa brjod dgos so //
analyzed: gzhan yang kun rdzob ces bya ba 'di yang ci yin pa brjod dgos so //
translated: Moreover, you must explain what this so-called ‚Äúconcealer‚Äù is.

original: gal te thams cad med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is nonexistence,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not correct,

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because existence and nonexistence are mutually exclusive.

original: 'di ltar kun rdzob ces bya ba ni nus pa med par smras par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar kun rdzob ces bya ba ni nus pa med par smras par 'gyur la /
translated: In this way, you would be saying that the so-called ‚Äúconcealer‚Äù is powerless.

original: skye ba la sogs pa zhes byas na ni de nus pa yin na /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa zhes byas na ni de nus pa yin na /
translated: But if you say that arising and so on are the concealer, they are powerful.

original: de ji ltar nus pa dang mi nus pa phan tshun 'gal ba 'di dag gcig la ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar nus pa dang mi nus pa phan tshun 'gal ba 'di dag gcig la ldan par 'gyur /
translated: How could these mutually exclusive powers and powerlessnesses be present in a single entity?

original: med pa'i sgo nas yod pa nyid 'grub par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: med pa'i sgo nas yod pa nyid 'grub par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: And how could existence be established on the basis of nonexistence?

original: ji ste thams cad med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ste thams cad med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If you say that not everything is nonexistent,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what is it?

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kho na kun rdzob yin no zhe na ni de'i tshe brtsad pa med de /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kho na kun rdzob yin no zhe na ni de'i tshe brtsad pa med de /
translated: If you say that the very reality of things is the concealer, then there is no dispute.

original: khyed kyis dam bcas pa ni nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyed kyis dam bcas pa ni nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Your thesis will be undermined.

original: dngos po yang skye ba kho na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po yang skye ba kho na zhes bya'o //
translated: And it is said that an entity is just what arises.

original: de'i phyir kun rdzob tu skye'o zhes bya ba ji skad du bshad par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir kun rdzob tu skye'o zhes bya ba ji skad du bshad par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how could it be explained that ‚Äúarising is conventional‚Äù?

original: skye ba skye bo zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: skye ba skye bo zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Arising is arising.

original: kun rdzob las bzlog pa skye ba med @141b pa yang don dam pa yin pas de'i tshe don dam par skye ba med do zhes bya ba skye ba med pa skye ba med do zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob las bzlog pa skye ba med @141b pa yang don dam pa yin pas de'i tshe don dam par skye ba med do zhes bya ba skye ba med pa skye ba med do zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since nonarising is the opposite of the conventional, it is the ultimate. Therefore, at that time, it would be said that ‚Äúnonarising is ultimate nonarising.‚Äù

original: de lta na ni brjod pa 'brel ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni brjod pa 'brel ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the statement would be meaningless.

original: gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang 'gal ba'i phyir mi srid pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang 'gal ba'i phyir mi srid pa kho na'o //
