translated: The conceptions of both and neither are also impossible because they are contradictory.

original: 'on te mi rtag pa'i don kun rdzob kyi don yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mi rtag pa'i don kun rdzob kyi don yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the meaning of conventional is impermanent,

original: de'i tshe mi rtag pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe mi rtag pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin /
translated: then what is this thing called ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù?

original: gal te rtag pa med pa tsam zhig yin na ni de'i sgo nas ji ltar 'gro ba la grags par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa med pa tsam zhig yin na ni de'i sgo nas ji ltar 'gro ba la grags par 'gyur /
translated: If it is the mere nonexistence of permanence, then how could it be known to the world?

original: 'on te rtag pa las gzhan pa zhig mi rtag pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rtag pa las gzhan pa zhig mi rtag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if something is impermanent because it is other than permanent,

original: rtag pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de ni shugs kyis na rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa yin pas de'i tshe kun rdzob tu yod do zhes byas na rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pas rtogs pa yod do zhes brjodüîΩpar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de ni shugs kyis na rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pa yin pas de'i tshe kun rdzob tu yod do zhes byas na rnam par rtog pa med pa'i shes pas rtogs pa yod do zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: then permanence is the nature of conceptualization, and so it is indirectly a nonconceptual consciousness. Therefore, if it is said that it exists conventionally, then it is said that it is realized by a nonconceptual consciousness.

original: de lta yin na ni ji ltar na dngos po'i ngo bo nyid khas ma blangs pa yin /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni ji ltar na dngos po'i ngo bo nyid khas ma blangs pa yin /
translated: If that is so, how could you not accept the nature of things?

original: rjes su dpag pas rtog pa yang spang ba byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas rtog pa yang spang ba byas par 'gyur te /
translated: Also, conceptual thought would be rejected,

original: de ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩji ste 'jig rten la grags pa kun rdzob yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro // ji ste 'jig rten la grags pa kun rdzob yin no zhe na /
translated: because it is conceptual.üîΩIf you say that the conventional is what is known to the world,

original: de la yang 'jig rten 'di gang yin par 'dod /
analyzed: de la yang 'jig rten 'di gang yin par 'dod /
translated: then what is this world that you assert?

original: ci bstan bcos byed pa rnams sam //
analyzed: ci bstan bcos byed pa rnams sam //
translated: Are the treatises composed by many authors,

original: 'on te skye bo phal pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te skye bo phal pa yin /
translated: or are they composed by ordinary people?

original: rnam par rtog pa dang po ltar na dngos po la phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin du mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang po ltar na dngos po la phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin du mar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is the first case, then entities would have many mutually contradictory natures,

original: gcig la yang bstan bcos byed pa mang po rnams rnam pa du mar sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la yang bstan bcos byed pa mang po rnams rnam pa du mar sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because many authors of treatises superimpose many aspects on a single entity.

original: gnyis pa ltar na bdag med pa dang las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa khas blang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ltar na bdag med pa dang las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa khas blang bar mi bya ste /
translated: If it is the second case, then selflessness, karma and its effects, and so on, should not be accepted,

original: 'di dag ni skye bo phal pa la grags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni skye bo phal pa la grags pa ma yin no //
translated: because these are not renowned to ordinary people.

original: 'on te sgyu ma'i don kun rdzob kyi don yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sgyu ma'i don kun rdzob kyi don yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the meaning of illusion is the meaning of conventional reality,

original: de la yang sgyu ma'i don zhes bya ba 'di gang yin pa brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de la yang sgyu ma'i don zhes bya ba 'di gang yin pa brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: then it must be stated what this so-called meaning of illusion is.

original: gal te thams cad med pa yin na ni sngar bshad pa'i nyes par yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te thams cad med pa yin na ni sngar bshad pa'i nyes par yang 'gyur la /
translated: If everything is nonexistent, then the previously explained faults would ensue,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag tu yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dag tu yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: and how could there be the thoroughly afflicted and the completely purified?

original: 'on te sgyu ma nor ba'i shes pas yin na ni de'i tshe 'di shes bya nang gi yin pa'i tshul las khyad par ci yod /
analyzed: 'on te sgyu ma nor ba'i shes pas yin na ni de'i tshe 'di shes bya nang gi yin pa'i tshul las khyad par ci yod /
translated: But if it is by a mistaken consciousness, then what is the difference between this and the mode of being of the object of knowledge?

original: ji ste kun rdzob sgra tsam zhig yin na ni de'i tshe legs par bshad pa dang nyes par bshad pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba yang mi 'gyur te /üîΩbstan par bya ba'i don med na sgra tsam la @142a * //
analyzed: ji ste kun rdzob sgra tsam zhig yin na ni de'i tshe legs par bshad pa dang nyes par bshad pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba yang mi 'gyur te / bstan par bya ba'i don med na sgra tsam la @142a * //
translated: If the conventional is mere sound, then the distinction of good and bad explanations, etc. would not be possible.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩji ste sgra'i don yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro // ji ste sgra'i don yin no zhe na /
translated: If the object to be expressed does not exist, then there is no difference in mere sound.

original: de'i tshe ci yang khyad par med par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe ci yang khyad par med par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it is the meaning of the sound, then how can there be no difference at all?

original: bde ba la sogs pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba gang yin pa de dag kyang gang gi nang du bsdu bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba gang yin pa de dag kyang gang gi nang du bsdu bar 'gyur /
translated: How can those things that are to be known by each person‚Äôs own experience, such as pleasure, etc., be included in that?

original: re zhig kun rdzob tu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig kun rdzob tu ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not included in the conventional,

original: de dag brjod du med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de dag brjod du med pa'i phyir la /
translated: because they are inexpressible,

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni tha snyad gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni tha snyad gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the conventional truth is that which is to be designated by expressions.

original: de skad du mdo las kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de skad du mdo las kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is conventional truth?

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ji snyed yi ge dang sgras bstan pa yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ji snyed yi ge dang sgras bstan pa yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is whatever is taught by means of letters and words, to the extent that they are worldly conventions.

original: 'dis ni mdor na kun rdzob sgra'i don yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //üîΩ'on te snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don de dag gcig tu byas nas spyi'i rnam pa gzung ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni mdor na kun rdzob sgra'i don yin no zhes bshad pa yin no // 'on te snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don de dag gcig tu byas nas spyi'i rnam pa gzung ste /
translated: In brief, this passage explains that the conventional is the referent of words.

original: de skad du brjod do zhes bya bar 'dod na ni de'i tshe don dam pa la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de skad du brjod do zhes bya bar 'dod na ni de'i tshe don dam pa la yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you maintain that the referent that appears and is imagined is taken as a whole and grasped as a general image and is then expressed in words, then it follows that the ultimate truth would also be conventional truth,

original: de yang tshig gi ngo bor gzhag par brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang tshig gi ngo bor gzhag par brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is also expressed in words.

original: de dag don dam pa'i bden pa'i nang du 'dus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag don dam pa'i bden pa'i nang du 'dus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not included in ultimate truth,

original: de la dngos por yod pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dngos por yod pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not an existent entity.

original: bden pa'i khyad par gzhan gyis kha bskang bar bya ba'i rnam pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bden pa'i khyad par gzhan gyis kha bskang bar bya ba'i rnam pa gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other way to complete the definition of truth.

original: 'on te brten nas skyes pa'i gzugs dang bde ba la sogs pa rang rig pa dag la yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes ming du 'dogs na ni dga' dgur thogs la /
analyzed: 'on te brten nas skyes pa'i gzugs dang bde ba la sogs pa rang rig pa dag la yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes ming du 'dogs na ni dga' dgur thogs la /
translated: But if you call the form and pleasure, etc., which are produced in dependence and are self-cognized, ‚Äúconventional truth,‚Äù then we agree.üîΩGive me some food!

original: zan yang byin cig / phyin ci ma log pa de cung zad yod pas brtsad pa med do //
analyzed: zan yang byin cig / phyin ci ma log pa de cung zad yod pas brtsad pa med do //
translated: Since there is a little non-erroneous [truth], there is no dispute.

original: ji ste skad cig las phan chad du mi gnas pa'i phyir mi brtan pa'i don ni kun rdzob kyi don no //
analyzed: ji ste skad cig las phan chad du mi gnas pa'i phyir mi brtan pa'i don ni kun rdzob kyi don no //
translated: If the meaning of ‚Äúconventional‚Äù is ‚Äúunstable,‚Äù because it does not remain beyond the moment,

original: de las bzlog pa rtag pa'i don ni don dam pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa rtag pa'i don ni don dam pa'o zhe na /
translated: and the meaning of ‚Äúultimate‚Äù is ‚Äúpermanent,‚Äù the opposite of that,

original: de lta yin na grub pa sgrub pa nyid de /
analyzed: de lta yin na grub pa sgrub pa nyid de /
translated: then this is just the establishment of what is already established.

original: 'di ltar khyed kyis kyang dngos po skad cig par khas blangs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed kyis kyang dngos po skad cig par khas blangs la /
translated: Because you also accept that things are momentary.

original: kho bo cag kyang der zad pas brtsad pa med do //
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang der zad pas brtsad pa med do //
translated: Since we also accept that, there is no dispute.

original: de bzhin du kun rdzob kyi dngos po'i spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa de don dam par yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du kun rdzob kyi dngos po'i spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo bdag med pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa de don dam par yin la /
translated: Similarly, the nature of the general characteristic of conventional things is the ultimate, which is the reality of things such as selflessness, etc.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung /
translated: Moreover, whether or not the Tathagatas arise,

original: dus thams cad du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir rtag par 'dod do //
analyzed: dus thams cad du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir rtag par 'dod do //
translated: it is asserted to be permanent because it is unchanging at all times.

original: 'on te mi bden pa'i don kun rdzob yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mi bden pa'i don kun rdzob yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the meaning of ‚Äúunreal‚Äù is ‚Äúconventional,‚Äù

original: de'i tshe ji ltar de bden par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar de bden par 'gyur /
translated: then how could it be real?

original: gcig la bden pa dang mi bden pa @142b nyid phan tshun 'gal ba ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gcig la bden pa dang mi bden pa @142b nyid phan tshun 'gal ba ni mi 'thad do //
translated: It is untenable that one thing is both real and unreal, since these are mutually exclusive.

original: kun rdzob ni dngos po'i ngo bo ci yang rung ba zhig tu khas blangs bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: kun rdzob ni dngos po'i ngo bo ci yang rung ba zhig tu khas blangs bar bya dgos so //
translated: It is necessary to accept that the conventional is some kind of entity.

original: de lta ma yin na ji ltar des 'gro ba la bden pa zhes bya bar grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ji ltar des 'gro ba la bden pa zhes bya bar grub par 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could it be established as real for the world?

original: de khas len na ni dam bcas pa'i don bor ba yin no //
analyzed: de khas len na ni dam bcas pa'i don bor ba yin no //
translated: If you accept that, then you have abandoned the meaning of your thesis.

original: gzhan yang kun rdzob tshad ma 'am tshad ma ma yin pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gzhan yang kun rdzob tshad ma 'am tshad ma ma yin pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: Moreover, is the conventional valid knowledge or not?

original: gal te tshad ma yin na ni 'di ji ltar kun rdzob yin /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma yin na ni 'di ji ltar kun rdzob yin /
translated: If it is valid knowledge, then how could it be conventional?

original: 'on te tshad ma ma yin na ni 'di las ji ltar bdag med pa 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te tshad ma ma yin na ni 'di las ji ltar bdag med pa 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: But if it is not a valid cognition, how can it establish selflessness?

original: gdon mi za bar kun rdzob kyi sa bon rnam par shes pa la sogs pa don dam par yod pa yang khas blang dgos te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar kun rdzob kyi sa bon rnam par shes pa la sogs pa don dam par yod pa yang khas blang dgos te /
translated: Undoubtedly, you must accept that the seeds of the conventional, such as consciousness, exist ultimately.

original: sa bon med pa'i kun rdzob ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: sa bon med pa'i kun rdzob ni mi 'thad do //
translated: A conventional without seeds is untenable.

original: sa bon gang yin pa de nyid ni dngos por grub pa yin no //
analyzed: sa bon gang yin pa de nyid ni dngos por grub pa yin no //
translated: And that which is the seed is an established entity.

original: gzhan yang dngos po'i ngo bo khas len na de la sgro btags pa brdzun pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po'i ngo bo khas len na de la sgro btags pa brdzun pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, if you accept the nature of an entity, then that which is the nature of a false superimposition on that is conventional truth.

original: sgro ma btags pa dngos po'i ngo bo ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin pas bden pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgro ma btags pa dngos po'i ngo bo ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin pas bden pa gnyis rnam par dbye ba rung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de lta bas na skye ba med pa la sogs pa kho na don dam pa'o zhes bya bar nges so //

original: gal te de lta yin na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na /

analyzed: 'o na ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /

analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum po ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum las dgongs nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par bstan zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ni nyes ba med de /

analyzed: log tu gyur pa gang dag kun rdzob tu yod pa ma yin pa brdzun pa kho na la yang rtag pa la sogs pa'i dngos por sgro 'dogs shing gzugs la sogs pa ji ltar snang ba yang ji lta ba de bzhin du yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ba
translated: superimpose permanence and so forth on what is false and does not exist conventionally and they grasp forms and so on just as they appear.üîΩSince they fall into the two extremes of superimposition and denial, they do not enter the ocean of the ultimate mode, which is free of the two extremes and is extremely profound.

original: de dag sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis su lhung ba'i blos don dam pa'i tshul gyi rgya mtsho mtha' gnyis dang bral ba shin tu zab mo la mi 'jug pas de'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis skye ba med pa la sogs pa bstan
analyzed: de dag sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis su lhung ba'i blos don dam pa'i tshul gyi rgya mtsho mtha' gnyis dang bral ba shin tu zab mo la mi 'jug pas de'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis skye ba med pa la sogs pa bstan
translated: Therefore the Bhagavat taught nonarising and so on for their sake.

original: pa don dam pa'i dbang du mdzad pa kho nar brjod cing ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum gyi dgongs pa bstan pas dbu ma'i lam mtha' gnyis dang bral ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir nges pa'i don kho na gzhung 'dzugs par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: pa don dam pa'i dbang du mdzad pa kho nar brjod cing ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum gyi dgongs pa bstan pas dbu ma'i lam mtha' gnyis dang bral ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir nges pa'i don kho na gzhung 'dzugs par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: He taught the three kinds of realitylessness in order to show the middle path free from the two extremes.

original: dbu ma pa rnams kyang ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par gzhag pa khas mi len pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbu ma pa rnams kyang ngo bo nyid gsum rnam par gzhag pa khas mi len pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The Madhyamikas do not deny the presentation of the three realities.

original: gzhan du na mthong ba la sogs pa dang 'gal ba ji ltar spongs par 'gyur /üîΩde la dngos po ma brtags na grags pa ji ltar snang ba sgyu ma bzhin du brten nas byung ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin no //

translated: Otherwise, how could they avoid contradicting what is seen and so on?üîΩAmong them, the relative reality is that which, without examination, is renowned as an illusion-like dependent origination.

original: de yang kun rdzob tu sgyu ma bzhin du gzhan gyi rkyen gyi dbang gis skye'i bdag nyid kho na ni ma yin pas skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de yang kun rdzob tu sgyu ma bzhin du gzhan gyi rkyen gyi dbang gis skye'i bdag nyid kho na ni ma yin pas skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: That is established as realitylessness of production, because it is produced by the power of other conditions, like an illusion, and not by itself.

original: ma byung ba la byung ba dang / byung nas med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma byung ba la byung ba dang / byung nas med pa yang ma yin te /

analyzed: gcig la yod pa dang med pa dag ni rim gyis kyang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las byung na ni //

analyzed: rang bzhin dag ni ji lta bur //

analyzed: byas pa can zhes bya bar 'gyur //

original: gal te rang bzhin gyis yod 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gyis yod 'gyur //
translated: If it existed by intrinsic reality,

analyzed: de ni med pa nyid mi 'gyur // rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur bar ni //
translated: It would not become nonexistent.üîΩIntrinsic reality never

original: nam yang 'thad pa ma yin no //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: nam yang 'thad pa ma yin no // zhes bshad do //
translated: Makes sense as transforming.

original: yang ngo bo nyid kyis yod yin na //
analyzed: yang ngo bo nyid kyis yod yin na //
translated: If it existed by intrinsic reality,

original: med par rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: med par rung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not suitable to be nonexistent.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'phags pa klu'i @150b rgyal po ma dros pas zhus pa las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'phags pa klu'i @150b rgyal po ma dros pas zhus pa las /

original: gang zhig rkyen las skyes pa de ma skyes //
analyzed: gang zhig rkyen las skyes pa de ma skyes //

original: de la skye ba'i rang bzhin yod ma yin //
analyzed: de la skye ba'i rang bzhin yod ma yin //

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //

analyzed: klu'i rgyal po rgya mtshos zhus pa las /

analyzed: gang dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung // de dag ngo bo nyid kyis med //
translated: Whatever is dependently arisenüîΩis essentially nonexistent.

original: gang dag ngo bo nyid med pa //
analyzed: gang dag ngo bo nyid med pa //
translated: Whatever is essentially nonexistent

original: de dag gang du'ang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag gang du'ang mi 'byung ngo //

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa yab dang sras mjal ba las kyang /

analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la 'jug pas chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa bstan te /

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de la ma rig pa ni ma rig pa nyid kyis ma mchis so //
translated: Blessed One, ignorance does not exist due to ignorance itself.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa ni ngo bo nyid dang bral ba lags so //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa ni ngo bo nyid dang bral ba lags so //

analyzed: chos gang la ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa de ni dngos po ma mchis pa'o //

analyzed: gang dngos po ma mchis pa de ni yongs su ma grub pa'o //

analyzed: de 'gag par yang mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gang ma skyes ma 'gags pa de ni 'das pa zhes gdags par bgyi ba ma lags /

analyzed: gang dus gsum du yang mi 'thad pa de ni ming ma mchis pa / mtshan nyid ma mchis pa / mtshan ma ma mchis pa /

original: gdags su ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: gdags su ma mchis pa ste /
translated: does not have a sign,üîΩand cannot be designated.

original: sems can rnams gzung ba'i phyir ming tsam dang / brda tsam dang / tha snyad tsam dang / kun rdzob tsam dang / brjod pa tsam dang / gdags pa tsam ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: sems can rnams gzung ba'i phyir ming tsam dang / brda tsam dang / tha snyad tsam dang / kun rdzob tsam dang / brjod pa tsam dang / gdags pa tsam ni ma gtogs so //

original: ma rig pa ni don dam par mi dmigs so //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni don dam par mi dmigs so //

analyzed: chos gang don dam par mi dmigs pa de ni gdags par bgyi ba ma lags /

original: tha snyad gdags par bgyi ba ma lags /
analyzed: tha snyad gdags par bgyi ba ma lags /
translated: is not something to be designated conventionally,

original: brjod par bgyi ba ma lags te /
analyzed: brjod par bgyi ba ma lags te /

original: bcom ldan 'das ming tsam dang brda tsam gang lags pa de yang yang dag pa ma lags so zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ming tsam dang brda tsam gang lags pa de yang yang dag pa ma lags so zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: BhagavƒÅn, that which is mere name and mere convention is also not real.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the other-dependent nature is not reasonable as a real nature.

original: de lta na ni sgyu ma la sogs pa yang dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni sgyu ma la sogs pa yang dngos po nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were, then even illusions and so on would become real things,

original: de dag kyang @151a * //
analyzed: de dag kyang @151a * //
translated: because they also

original: rkyen la rag las par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen la rag las par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are not different in being dependent on conditions.

original: de bas na gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid 'di sgyu ma dang khyad par med pa nyid kyi phyir skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid 'di sgyu ma dang khyad par med pa nyid kyi phyir skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, this other-dependent entity is established as having the essential nature of production that is essenceless, because it is not different from an illusion.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus,

original: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa de nyid las dper na sgyu ma byas pa ltar de bzhin du skye ba ngo bo nyid med par nye bar blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //

translated: in the noble Unraveling of the Intention itself, it says, ‚ÄúJust as an illusion is created, so should one view production as essenceless.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid sgyu ma la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa de nyid la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa don dam pa pa'i rang gi ngo bor sgro 'dogs pa gang yin pa de ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid sgyu ma la sogs pa dang khyad par med pa de nyid la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa don dam pa pa'i rang gi ngo bor sgro 'dogs pa gang yin pa de ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid
translated: The imagined nature is the superimposition of the essential nature of ultimate reality, such as permanence or impermanence, on that very other-dependent nature, which is not different from an illusion and so forth.

original: do // de yang ji ltar kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: do // de yang ji ltar kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: That is established as having the essential nature of character that is essenceless, because it is not established as having the character of the imagined.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa 'di yang dngos su na gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kho na la rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa 'di yang dngos su na gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kho na la rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: This realitylessness is to be posited as just the relative reality, in fact.

original: de nyid la de'i mtshan nyid du nye bar brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid la de'i mtshan nyid du nye bar brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its reality is imagined as its reality-characteristic.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad mi rtag pa la sogs pa ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa pas stong pa'i phyir ma skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad mi rtag pa la sogs pa ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa pas stong pa'i phyir ma skyes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all things are unproduced because of being empty of the ultimate reality-characteristic posited as impermanent, etc.

original: de'i phyir ma 'gags pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma 'gags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are unceased.

original: de'i phyir gzod ma nas zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzod ma nas zhi ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are primordially peaceful.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are naturally in a state of nirvana.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba de nyid las /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba de nyid las /
translated: In that very noble Unraveling of the Thought:

original: gang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis med pa de ni ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis med pa de ni ma skyes pa'o //
translated: That which does not exist by intrinsic identity is not produced.

original: gang ma skyes pa de ni ma 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: gang ma skyes pa de ni ma 'gags pa'o //
translated: That which is not produced is not ceased.

original: gang ma 'gags pa de ni gzod ma nas zhi ba'o //
analyzed: gang ma 'gags pa de ni gzod ma nas zhi ba'o //
translated: That which is not ceased is primordially peaceful.

original: gang gzod ma nas zhi ba de ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gzod ma nas zhi ba de ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: That which is primordially peaceful is naturally completely extinguished.

original: yang de lta bas na ngas mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las dgongs nas chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes bshad do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa der yang sgra ji bzhin gyi don du yongs su rtog pa de sel bar yang mdzad la /
analyzed: yang de lta bas na ngas mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid las dgongs nas chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes bshad do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa der yang sgra ji bzhin gyi don du yongs su rtog pa de sel bar yang mdzad la /
translated: And in the statement, ‚ÄúTherefore, I explained that all phenomena are unproduced, intending the lack of nature with respect to characteristics,‚Äù he also eliminates the conception of literal meaning.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kun rdzob pa la ji skad bshad pa'i kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis dben pa sgrub cing skur ba mi 'debs pa'i kun rdzob kyi ngo bo yang ston pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kun rdzob pa la ji skad bshad pa'i kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis dben pa sgrub cing skur ba mi 'debs pa'i kun rdzob kyi ngo bo yang ston pa yin gyi /
translated: He also teaches the nature of the conventional, which is free from the imputed nature in the dependent nature, as it was explained, and which is not a deprecation.

original: don dam pa nyid du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa nyid du ni ma yin no //
translated: But he does not do so in terms of the ultimate.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'ga' yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'ga' yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable for anything to be an entity that lacks characteristics.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it was said:

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos @151b po ni //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos @151b po ni //
translated: An entity without characteristics

original: 'ga' yang gang na'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'ga' yang gang na'ang yod ma yin //
translated: Does not exist anywhere.

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is what is meant.

original: chos thams cad don dam par rtag tu rang bzhin gyis ngo bo nyid med pa kho nar gnas pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad don dam par rtag tu rang bzhin gyis ngo bo nyid med pa kho nar gnas pa gang yin pa de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: The consummate nature is that which is the very reality of all phenomena, which is always and ultimately devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: de ni rtag tu sgro btags pa med pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu sgro btags pa med pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is always established as being without superimposition.

translated: Moreover, it is called the ultimate because it is the very reality that is established by valid cognition, and it is also called the realitylessness that is distinguished by the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the ultimate realitylessness.

original: de skad du 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /üîΩde ni don dam pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de skad du 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las / de ni don dam pa yang yin la /

original: de la gal te shes rab nyam chung ba'i phyir de lta bu'i chos nyid zab mo la bdag nyid kyis mos par mi nus su zin kyang /
analyzed: de la gal te shes rab nyam chung ba'i phyir de lta bu'i chos nyid zab mo la bdag nyid kyis mos par mi nus su zin kyang /
translated: In that regard, if one is unable to believe in such a profound reality by oneself because of having little wisdom,

original: 'on kyang rtog pa dang ldan pa rang gi blo gros nyam chung ba'i nyes pa mthong ba rnams kyis de spang bar yang rigs pa ma yin la /üîΩbdag nyid phung bas gzhan dag kyang don chen po las nyams par byas te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rtog pa dang ldan pa rang gi blo gros nyam chung ba'i nyes pa mthong ba rnams kyis de spang bar yang rigs pa ma yin la / bdag nyid phung bas gzhan dag kyang don chen po las nyams par byas te /
translated: then, even though one has little wisdom, it is not right to abandon it because one sees the fault of one‚Äôs own little intelligence.

original: brlag par bya bar ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brlag par bya bar ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not right to destroy oneself and cause others to fall from the great purpose.üîΩIt is not right to destroy oneself and cause others to fall from the great purpose.

original: de lta na ni rang dang gzhan la 'khu ba byas pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni rang dang gzhan la 'khu ba byas pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, you would be only deceiving yourself and others.

original: de lta bas na blo gros dang ldan pa dad pa can gyis chos zab mo dag spong ba'i lta ba bor te /
analyzed: de lta bas na blo gros dang ldan pa dad pa can gyis chos zab mo dag spong ba'i lta ba bor te /
translated: Therefore, the wise who have faith should abandon the view that rejects the profound teachings.

original: de la yang bcom ldan 'das nyid tshad mar byas shing bdag nyid mi shes pa'i nyes pas de khong du mi chud pa srid do snyam du bsams nas mdo zab mo dag la dad pa bskyed de /
analyzed: de la yang bcom ldan 'das nyid tshad mar byas shing bdag nyid mi shes pa'i nyes pas de khong du mi chud pa srid do snyam du bsams nas mdo zab mo dag la dad pa bskyed de /
translated: Thinking, ‚ÄúThe Lord Buddha himself is the authority, and it is possible that I do not understand because of the fault of my own ignorance,‚Äù they should develop faith in the profound scriptures.

original: mnyan pa dang / gzung ba dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa la mngon par brtson par bya'o //üîΩgzhan dag kyang yang dag par len du gzhug go //
analyzed: mnyan pa dang / gzung ba dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa la mngon par brtson par bya'o // gzhan dag kyang yang dag par len du gzhug go //
translated: They should strive to listen to them, to hold them, and to meditate on them.üîΩThey should also encourage others to take up these teachings.

original: bdag nyid de la mos par bya ba'i phyir smon lam gdab par yang bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid de la mos par bya ba'i phyir smon lam gdab par yang bya'o //
translated: And they should make aspirations to have faith in them.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las /
translated: For this very reason, the noble Jewel Mound Sutra says:

original: chos zab mo gang dag la 'di'i blos gting mi dpogs pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa kho na tshad mar byas nas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ni mtha' yas te /
analyzed: chos zab mo gang dag la 'di'i blos gting mi dpogs pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa kho na tshad mar byas nas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ni mtha' yas te /
translated: The TathƒÅgata alone is the authority for the profound Dharma, the depths of which are not fathomed by his intellect.

original: mos pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyi sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos bstan pa la 'jug pas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis mkhyen gyi /
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs pa nyid kyi sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos bstan pa la 'jug pas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis mkhyen gyi /
translated: The enlightenment of the Buddha is infinite, and the teachings of the TathƒÅgatas are entered by way of various inclinations. Therefore, the TathƒÅgata himself knows,

original: bdag gis ni mi shes so snyam nas spong bar ni mi byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag gis ni mi shes so snyam nas spong bar ni mi byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: but I do not know.

original: de ltar re zhig lung gi sgo nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig lung gi sgo nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in this way, all phenomena are established as essenceless by means of scripture.

original: gang yang skye ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni gnyis su snang ba'i shes pa kho nas byed kyi /
analyzed: gang yang skye ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba ni gnyis su snang ba'i shes pa kho nas byed kyi /
translated: The classifications of arising and so on are made only by the consciousness that perceives duality.

original: rang rig pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang rig pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not made by the mere reflexive awareness.

original: gnyis su snang ba yang brdzun pa'i phyir des rnam par gzhag pa'i ngo bo yang brdzun pa kho na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis su snang ba yang brdzun pa'i phyir des rnam par gzhag pa'i ngo bo yang brdzun pa kho na'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Because dualistic appearances are false, the nature of things that is posited by them is false.üîΩ

original: gal te chos thams cad skye ba la sogs pa'i chos nyid shes pa brdzun pa'i ngo bor snang bas rnam par gzhag pa'i ngo bo yin na ni de ji ltar 'di dag don dam par yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad skye ba la sogs pa'i chos nyid shes pa brdzun pa'i ngo bor snang bas rnam par gzhag pa'i ngo bo yin na ni de ji ltar 'di dag don dam par yod par 'gyur /
translated: But if the nature of phenomena is posited by false consciousness, how can they exist ultimately?

original: @166a * // gnyis su snang ba yang brdzun pa nyid yin na ni shes pa'i ngo bo gang don dam par srid par 'gyur ba gzhan ci zhig lus /
analyzed: @166a * // gnyis su snang ba yang brdzun pa nyid yin na ni shes pa'i ngo bo gang don dam par srid par 'gyur ba gzhan ci zhig lus /
translated: If even dualistic appearance is false, what other nature of consciousness could ultimately exist?

original: shes pa de kho na nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba gzhan ni tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis yang dag par myong ba med de /
analyzed: shes pa de kho na nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba gzhan ni tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis yang dag par myong ba med de /
translated: The nature of consciousness, free from the aspects of subject and object, is not experienced by those who see only the surface.

original: thams cad de kho na nyid mthong ba kho na nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad de kho na nyid mthong ba kho na nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would follow, absurdly, that everyone would see reality.

original: de ni rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not ascertained by inference,

original: de lta bu'i rtags nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rtags nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because such a reason itself is not established.

original: 'di ltar re zhig rang bzhin gyi rtags las byung bas rjes su dpag pa ni mi srid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig rang bzhin gyi rtags las byung bas rjes su dpag pa ni mi srid de /
translated: Thus, first, inference from a reason of essence is impossible,

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its essence itself is what is to be proven.

original: 'bras bu'i rtags kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rtags kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it a reason of effect,

original: gnyis su med pa dang 'ga' yang lhan cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por ma grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa dang 'ga' yang lhan cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por ma grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: because nondualism is not established as a causal or resultant entity with anything at all,

original: de ni dbang pos mi sod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dbang pos mi sod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not apprehended by the senses.

original: de las ma gtogs pa'i 'bras bu gzhan yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa'i 'bras bu gzhan yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there any other effect that exists apart from that,

original: 'di ltar khyed kyi ltar na gnyis su med pa de kho na 'bras bur 'gyur ba zhig na de nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir de yang tshad mas grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed kyi ltar na gnyis su med pa de kho na 'bras bur 'gyur ba zhig na de nyid bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir de yang tshad mas grub pa ma yin no //
translated: because, according to you, that nondualism would be the effect, but it is not established by valid knowledge, because it is the very occasion of what is to be proven.

original: gnyis su snang ba gang yin pa de ni ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba'i phyir 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su snang ba gang yin pa de ni ri bong gi rva dang 'dra ba'i phyir 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: Whatever appears as dual is not a result, because it is like the horn of a rabbit.

original: gang gis na mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas sgrub pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'grub par 'gyur ba don dam par gnyis su med pa'i shes pas kyang 'ga' yang 'dzin pa med do //
analyzed: gang gis na mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas sgrub pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'grub par 'gyur ba don dam par gnyis su med pa'i shes pas kyang 'ga' yang 'dzin pa med do //
translated: Since ultimately nothing is apprehended by nondual consciousness, how could direct perception and non-observation establish the existence of the result and the cause?

original: mi dmigs pa yang dgag pa sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir yod pa sgrub pa'i skabs ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa yang dgag pa sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir yod pa sgrub pa'i skabs ma yin no //
translated: And since non-observation establishes a negation, it is not a means of establishing existence.

original: gal te 'di snyam du de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: If you think that a valid cognition that establishes that does exist,

original: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig gang gi ngo bo nyid dang 'gal ba de ni de'i ngo bos dben pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ga' zhig gang gi ngo bo nyid dang 'gal ba de ni de'i ngo bos dben pa yin te /
translated: then whatever is incompatible with the nature of something is devoid of the nature of that thing,

original: dper na grang ba'i ngo bo la gnod pa'i dro ba grang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa lta bu yin la /
analyzed: dper na grang ba'i ngo bo la gnod pa'i dro ba grang ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa lta bu yin la /
translated: just as heat, which is incompatible with the nature of cold, is devoid of the nature of cold.

original: rtogs pa'i ngo bo'i chos can yang gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid la gnod pa yin pas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i ngo bo'i chos can yang gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid la gnod pa yin pas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The property of the probandum is also the essence of the object of knowledge, and it is contradictory to be the essence of both. Therefore, the reason is the observation of contradiction that pervades.

original: gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The reason is not unestablished.

original: spyir dga' ba dang mi dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong ba'i chos can rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba rtogs pa'i ngo bo grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyir dga' ba dang mi dga' ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyams su myong ba'i chos can rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba rtogs pa'i ngo bo grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In general, the property of the probandum, consciousness, which is the object of knowledge that experiences the aspect of pleasure, pain, and so on, is established as the essence of the object of knowledge.

original: rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the case that its own nature is not established.

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i sgo nas ngo bo nyid med pa @166b nyid kyis de la ltos nas rab tu brtags pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yang ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i sgo nas ngo bo nyid med pa @166b nyid kyis de la ltos nas rab tu brtags pa'i 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yang ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the apprehended aspect is essenceless in terms of being free from being a single or multiple entity, the aspect of the apprehender that is imputed in dependence on that is also essenceless.

original: thams cad dngos po med par yang thal ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad dngos po med par yang thal ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it follow that everything is a nonentity.

original: byed pa po dang las kyi ngo bo kho na la ltos pa tsam las nye bar brtags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir brdzun pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
analyzed: byed pa po dang las kyi ngo bo kho na la ltos pa tsam las nye bar brtags pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir brdzun pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
translated: If you think that the nature of the agent and action is only dependent on mere imputation, and therefore they are only false,

original: bdag nyid ni ma yin no snyam du sems na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid ni ma yin no snyam du sems na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: not real, that is also illogical.

original: gal te spyir don dam par gnyis kyis dben pa tsam zhig sgrub par 'dod na ni de'i tshe grub pa sgrub pa nyid de /
analyzed: gal te spyir don dam par gnyis kyis dben pa tsam zhig sgrub par 'dod na ni de'i tshe grub pa sgrub pa nyid de /
translated: If you generally assert that the mere absence of duality in the ultimate is established, then you are proving what is already established,

original: kho bo cag kyang don dam par gnyis brdzun pa'i phyir dben par 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang don dam par gnyis brdzun pa'i phyir dben par 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: because we also assert that ultimately the two are absent because they are false.

original: 'on te ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i don dam pa'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa dang bral ba nyid du sgrub par 'dod na ni de'i tshe yang grub pa sgrub pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i don dam pa'i sgo nas rnam par shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa dang bral ba nyid du sgrub par 'dod na ni de'i tshe yang grub pa sgrub pa nyid de /
translated: But if you assert that consciousness itself is established as free from aspects from the perspective of ultimate reality, which is not a nature, then you are also proving what is already established.

original: kho bo cag kyang don dam par chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir shes pa thams cad don dam par med pa la gnyis kyi rnam pa yang dag pa dang bral bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang don dam par chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir shes pa thams cad don dam par med pa la gnyis kyi rnam pa yang dag pa dang bral bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We also assert that ultimately all consciousnesses do not exist because all phenomena are non-arisen, and that they are free from the aspect of duality.

original: 'on te shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos can la gnyis dang bral ba nyid dang / dngos po'i ngo bo nyid gnyi ga yang sgrub par 'dod na ni de'i tshe dpe la rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa zhes bya ba'i chos can la gnyis dang bral ba nyid dang / dngos po'i ngo bo nyid gnyi ga yang sgrub par 'dod na ni de'i tshe dpe la rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pas gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: But if you assert that the subject called ‚Äúconsciousness‚Äù is free from duality and that the entity of things is both established, then at that time the example is not established as the reason, and the reason is not established.

original: phyi'i don gyi ngo bo grang ba dang / tsha ba dag yang dag par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi'i don gyi ngo bo grang ba dang / tsha ba dag yang dag par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the entity of external things, such as cold and heat, is not established.

original: shes pa gcig la yang shes pa dang snang ba'i ngo bo dag snang ba'i phyir mi 'gal ba nyid yod pas dpe bsgrub pas stong pa nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gcig la yang shes pa dang snang ba'i ngo bo dag snang ba'i phyir mi 'gal ba nyid yod pas dpe bsgrub pas stong pa nyid kyang yin no //
translated: Because the entity of consciousness and the entity of appearance appear in a single consciousness, there is no contradiction, and the example is also empty of establishment.

original: ji ste shes pa gnyis dang bral ba nyid grub na shugs kyis dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ji ste shes pa gnyis dang bral ba nyid grub na shugs kyis dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that if the absence of the two kinds of error were established, then the nature of reality would be established by implication,

original: blo gros 'di ni ngan pa yin te /
analyzed: blo gros 'di ni ngan pa yin te /
translated: that is a poor way of thinking,

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no connection.

original: 'di la gang la gnyis dang bral ba de la gdon mi za bar yang dag pa'i dngos po yod do zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba 'di ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: 'di la gang la gnyis dang bral ba de la gdon mi za bar yang dag pa'i dngos po yod do zhes bya ba'i 'brel ba 'di ci zhig yod de /
translated: What is the connection here that if something is free from the two, then it must have a real nature?

original: de bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir dang / de lta bu'i dpe ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzlog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma med pa'i phyir dang / de lta bu'i dpe ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no valid cognition that contradicts that, and because there is no example that establishes that.

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dang / gnyis po de nyid kyis ma nges par 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dang / gnyis po de nyid kyis ma nges par 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro //
translated: And because it is not ascertained by the two, like the son of a barren woman.

original: thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyis la gnyis po gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyis la gnyis po gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And because there is no infinite regress, the two do not exist in the other two.

original: grang ba la sogs pa'i reg pas dben pa'i dro ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo bzhin du gnyis kyi ngo bo las ma gtogs pa gang la de dang bral ba nyid du bsgrub par 'gyur @167a * //
analyzed: grang ba la sogs pa'i reg pas dben pa'i dro ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo bzhin du gnyis kyi ngo bo las ma gtogs pa gang la de dang bral ba nyid du bsgrub par 'gyur @167a * //
translated: Just as heat, etc., are the nature of being free from cold, etc., so too, what is there that is to be established as being free from the nature of the two?

original: ba rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid spyi'i ngo bo chos can gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ba rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid spyi'i ngo bo chos can gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no other object that is the nature of a general cognition.

original: gnyis po'i bdag nyid kho na rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis po'i bdag nyid kho na rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of cognition is just the nature of the two.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig bdag nyid kho na rab tu gsal zhing gsal ba gzhan la mi ltos pa de ni rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig bdag nyid kho na rab tu gsal zhing gsal ba gzhan la mi ltos pa de ni rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, that which is itself clearly manifest and does not depend on another is the characteristic of cognition.

original: lus dang / sa dang / ri dang / chu bo dang / rgya mtsho la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs phyi rol gyi ngo bo nyid du mdun na snang ba'i don gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid kho nas gsal ba'i phyir rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid las mi 'da' bar 'jug go //
analyzed: lus dang / sa dang / ri dang / chu bo dang / rgya mtsho la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs phyi rol gyi ngo bo nyid du mdun na snang ba'i don gang yin pa de ni bdag nyid kho nas gsal ba'i phyir rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid las mi 'da' bar 'jug go //
translated: Whatever object appears in front of us, such as the body, earth, mountains, rivers, oceans, etc., which have various external natures, is not beyond the nature of cognition, because it is clearly manifest by itself.

original: de yang brdzun pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rigs kyi khyim du 'jug par spyod pa na rang gi lus dang khyad par med par spyod pa'i mdza' mo lta bur rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / kun tu 'khyud pa ltar spyod pas dam pa ma yin pa'i gnyis po dang phrad pas sun phyung ba'i bdag nyid 'di yid brtan du ga la rung /
analyzed: de yang brdzun pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rigs kyi khyim du 'jug par spyod pa na rang gi lus dang khyad par med par spyod pa'i mdza' mo lta bur rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / kun tu 'khyud pa ltar spyod pas dam pa ma yin pa'i gnyis po dang phrad pas sun phyung ba'i bdag nyid 'di yid brtan du ga la rung /
translated: Moreover, when one engages in sexual intercourse with a woman who is of the same class as oneself, she is like a wife who is recognized as being of the same nature as one‚Äôs own body.üîΩHow could it be tenable that this self, which is the nature of the union of the two impure substances, is reliable?

original: de'i bdag nyid lta bu'i gnyis kyi ngo bo'i mdza' bo dang bral na gang gis na 'di gzhan dang mi phrad cing 'ba' zhig chos can du 'gyur ba'i gnas ni gang du yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid lta bu'i gnyis kyi ngo bo'i mdza' bo dang bral na gang gis na 'di gzhan dang mi phrad cing 'ba' zhig chos can du 'gyur ba'i gnas ni gang du yang mi 'thad do //
translated: When one is separated from a friend who is of the same nature as oneself, it is not tenable that one is a single basis that does not meet with another.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore the reason is simply not established.

original: mdo sde pa la sogs pa yang yang dag par na shes pa gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid du mi 'dod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: mdo sde pa la sogs pa yang yang dag par na shes pa gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid du mi 'dod pa kho na ste /
translated: SautrƒÅntikas and so on do not assert that in reality consciousness is of the nature of two.

original: cha shas med pa la de 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cha shas med pa la de 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is contradictory in the partless.

original: de'i phyir de gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid du sgrub pa yang ci zhig rab tu bsgrub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid du sgrub pa yang ci zhig rab tu bsgrub par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, what is it that is to be established as the nature of the non-duality of those two?

analyzed: gang gis na tha snyad thams cad chad par 'gyur ba / tha snyad kyi sgo nas rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa dang / so so'i skye bo gzhan gyi shes pa dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu mi 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
