original: shes pa gang zhig gang la gsal rab tu snang zhing mi slu bar skye ba de ni de la mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa gang zhig gang la gsal rab tu snang zhing mi slu bar skye ba de ni de la mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin te /
translated: Whatever consciousness arises in a person with respect to an object, clearly and non-erronenously, is a valid cognition with respect to that object.

original: dper na tha snyad du gzugs la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dper na tha snyad du gzugs la sogs pa la /
translated: For example, with respect to conventional things such as form,

original: mig la sogs pa ma nyams pa'i skyes bu'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ma nyams pa'i skyes bu'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: the visual consciousness of a person whose eyes are not impaired is a valid cognition.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi shes pa chos thams cad bdag med pa'i yul can yang gsal rab cing mi slu ba yin pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi shes pa chos thams cad bdag med pa'i yul can yang gsal rab cing mi slu ba yin pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The consciousness of yogins, which has as its object the selflessness of all phenomena, is also very clear and non-erronenous, and therefore it is a natural valid cognition.

original: de ltar na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis chos thams cad bdag med pa'i shes pa ni rigs pas bsgrub par bya ba yin na ci ste mkhas pa rnams yongs su ma gu bar byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: de ltar na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis chos thams cad bdag med pa'i shes pa ni rigs pas bsgrub par bya ba yin na ci ste mkhas pa rnams yongs su ma gu bar byed pa ma yin /
translated: Thus, if the consciousness of yogins that all phenomena are selfless were established by reasoning, why would the wise not be completely convinced by it?

original: gang yang gal te rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa de yang med pa zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la @171a * //
analyzed: gang yang gal te rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa de yang med pa zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la @171a * //
translated: If the consciousness of yogins were nonexistent,

original: sogs pa de smras pa de la yang gong du lan btab zin pa nyid de /
analyzed: sogs pa de smras pa de la yang gong du lan btab zin pa nyid de /
translated: The response to that has already been given above.

original: dngos po thams cad ri bong gi rva dang 'dra bar shin tu med pa nyid du ni mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ri bong gi rva dang 'dra bar shin tu med pa nyid du ni mi 'dod kyi /
translated: We do not assert that all things are utterly nonexistent, like the horns of a rabbit.

original: 'on kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du don dam par med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du don dam par med pa nyid do //
translated: However, they do not exist ultimately, like illusions and so on.

original: des na tha snyad thams cad ma bkag pa kho na ste /
analyzed: des na tha snyad thams cad ma bkag pa kho na ste /
translated: Therefore all conventions are not refuted at all.

original: ji skad du kho bo cag tha snyad kyang khas mi len pa ma yin te /üîΩbrjod do zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du kho bo cag tha snyad kyang khas mi len pa ma yin te / brjod do zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it was said, ‚ÄúWe do not accept even conventions.‚Äù

original: gang yang rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas kyang dngos po ma lus pa stong pa nyid du sgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas kyang dngos po ma lus pa stong pa nyid du sgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not possible to prove that all things are empty by means of inference,

original: gzhi chos can 'ga' yang ma grub pa'i phyir dang / dpe la sogs pa yang ma skyes pa'i phyir gtan tshigs thams cad gzhi dang rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa kho na'o zhes smras pa de yang 'brel pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhi chos can 'ga' yang ma grub pa'i phyir dang / dpe la sogs pa yang ma skyes pa'i phyir gtan tshigs thams cad gzhi dang rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa kho na'o zhes smras pa de yang 'brel pa med pa yin te /
translated: because you say that all reasons are either nonestablished with respect to the subject or not established with respect to their own nature because no basis, that is, subject, is established and because the example and so on are not produced. That is also incoherent.

original: 'di ltar re zhig gal te kho bo cag gis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du khas blangs pa la khyed thal bar 'gyur bar sgrub na ni de'i tshe 'di thal ba ma yin pa kho na ste /üîΩgang gi phyir kho bo cag gis dngos po rnams don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du khas blangs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig gal te kho bo cag gis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du khas blangs pa la khyed thal bar 'gyur bar sgrub na ni de'i tshe 'di thal ba ma yin pa kho na ste / gang gi phyir kho bo cag gis dngos po rnams don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du khas blangs so //
translated: In this way, if you argue that our assertion that things are essenceless entails the consequence that there would be no such things as inference and the object of inference, then this is not a consequence at all.üîΩFor we assert that ultimately things are essenceless.

original: de la yang gal te don dam par gtan tshigs dang dpe dang chos can la sogs pa med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dang / rjes su dpag par bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad mi 'jug go zhes thal bar sgrub na ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'di thal ba ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de la yang gal te don dam par gtan tshigs dang dpe dang chos can la sogs pa med pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dang / rjes su dpag par bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad mi 'jug go zhes thal bar sgrub na ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'di thal ba ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: If you argue that the consequence of our position is that because ultimately there are no such things as reasons, examples, subjects, and so forth, there can be no such things as inference, the object of inference, and so forth, then this is not a consequence at all, because it is just what we want.

original: kho bo cag kyang rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'di thams cad don dam par 'jug pa mi 'dod na gang gis na de med par thal ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang rjes su dpag pa dang rjes su dpag par bya ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'di thams cad don dam par 'jug pa mi 'dod na gang gis na de med par thal ba zhes bya ste /
translated: We also do not accept that all of these expressions, such as ‚Äúinference‚Äù and ‚Äúobject inferred,‚Äù are used in the ultimate sense. So how could it follow that they do not exist?

original: thal ba'i mtshan nyid ni mi 'dod par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar kho bo cag ni khyed kyis sun 'byin pa'i bar du yang don dam par ma skyes pa kho nar khas len te /
analyzed: thal ba'i mtshan nyid ni mi 'dod par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar kho bo cag ni khyed kyis sun 'byin pa'i bar du yang don dam par ma skyes pa kho nar khas len te /
translated: Because the definition of a reductio argument is that it shows the contradiction in the opponent‚Äôs position.üîΩThus, we accept that even your refutations are ultimately unarisen.

original: de'i phyir nyes pa'i go skabs 'ga' yang mi rnyed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyes pa'i go skabs 'ga' yang mi rnyed pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, you will never find an opportunity to fault us.

original: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas /
translated: This is why the Acarya has said:

original: gal te cung zad cig dmigs na ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i don gyis 'jug pa'am ;
analyzed: gal te cung zad cig dmigs na ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i don gyis 'jug pa'am ;
translated: If something were perceived, then one could engage in or disengage from it on the basis of perception, etc.

original: ldog par bya na de med pa'i phyir kho bo la klan ka med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ldog par bya na de med pa'i phyir kho bo la klan ka med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: But since it does not exist, I am not at fault.

original: 'on te gang zhig don dam par med pa de tha snyad du yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes thal bar sgrub na ni 'dir yang khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir thal ba ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'on te gang zhig don dam par med pa de tha snyad du yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes thal bar sgrub na ni 'dir yang khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir thal ba ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: But if you argue that whatever does not exist ultimately does not occur conventionally, then this is not a reductio argument, because the pervasion is not established.

original: tha snyad ni gang gis na 'di bdag nyid log na tha @171b snyad kyang log par 'gyur ba don dam pa ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis khyab pa ni med do //
analyzed: tha snyad ni gang gis na 'di bdag nyid log na tha @171b snyad kyang log par 'gyur ba don dam pa ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis khyab pa ni med do //
translated: For there is no pervasion of the conventional by the ultimate, such that if the former is eliminated, the latter would also be eliminated.

original: 'on kyang 'di ni de las bzlog pa kho nas khyab ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni de las bzlog pa kho nas khyab ste /
translated: But it is pervaded by the opposite of that,

original: tha snyad ni don dam par med pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad ni don dam par med pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the conventional is the nature of non-ultimate existence.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa dag ni don dam pa pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba yang tha snyad sna tshogs 'jug pa yang snang ste /
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa dag ni don dam pa pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba yang tha snyad sna tshogs 'jug pa yang snang ste /
translated: In dreams and so on, although there is no ultimate nature, various conventions are seen to occur.

original: de'i phyir tha snyad 'di thams cad kyang sprul pa dang / rmi lam la sogs pa dang 'dra bas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad 'di thams cad kyang sprul pa dang / rmi lam la sogs pa dang 'dra bas 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, all of these conventions are like illusions, dreams, and so on, and so there is no contradiction.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: sprul pa yi ni sprul pa dang // sgyu ma'i skyes bus sgyu ma sprul //üîΩdgag pa byed pa ci 'dra bar //
analyzed: sprul pa yi ni sprul pa dang // sgyu ma'i skyes bus sgyu ma sprul // dgag pa byed pa ci 'dra bar //
translated: An emanation creates another emanation, and a magical person creates a magical creation.üîΩWhat is the negation like?

original: dgag pa de yang ci 'drar 'gyur //
analyzed: dgag pa de yang ci 'drar 'gyur //
translated: What is the negatee like?

original: zhes bshad do //üîΩ'on te thams cad du bsgrub par bya ba dang / chos can la sogs pa don dam pa pa'i dngos por gyur pa kho nas rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir don dam par ngo bo nyid med pas rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad gdags par mi 'gyur ro zhes nyes
analyzed: zhes bshad do // 'on te thams cad du bsgrub par bya ba dang / chos can la sogs pa don dam pa pa'i dngos por gyur pa kho nas rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir don dam par ngo bo nyid med pas rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad gdags par mi 'gyur ro zhes nyes
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: pa brjod na ni /
analyzed: pa brjod na ni /
translated: But if you say that because the object to be established, the subject, and so on are only ultimately existent things, the conventions of inference and so on are applied only to ultimately existent things, and so the conventions of inference and so on would not be applied to things that are ultimately natureless,üîΩthen

original: 'di yang nyes pa med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di yang nyes pa med pa kho na ste /
translated: this is also faultless,

original: rtsod pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir don dam pa pa'i chos can la sogs pas rjes su dpag pa la sogs par tha snyad gdags pa ni gang du yang ma grub bo //
analyzed: rtsod pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir don dam pa pa'i chos can la sogs pas rjes su dpag pa la sogs par tha snyad gdags pa ni gang du yang ma grub bo //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that there would be no debate. Nowhere is the convention of inference and so on applied to an ultimately existent subject and so on.

original: 'on kyang 'jig rten na ji ltar grags pa'i chos can kho na la gnas te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig rten na ji ltar grags pa'i chos can kho na la gnas te /
translated: But we do so only in terms of the subject and so on as they are known in the world.

original: rab tu smra ba rnams de kho na nyid gtan la dbab pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: rab tu smra ba rnams de kho na nyid gtan la dbab pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug par byed de /
translated: The logicians engage in conventions such as inference in order to determine reality.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩHow are the properties and property-possessors posited,

original: chos dang chos can rnam gzhag dang // tha dad tha dad min ci 'dra //
analyzed: chos dang chos can rnam gzhag dang // tha dad tha dad min ci 'dra //
translated: as different or non-different?

original: de nyid don brtags ma yin gyi //
analyzed: de nyid don brtags ma yin gyi //
translated: This is not an examination of the ultimate meaning,

original: 'jig rten na ni ji ltar grags //
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni ji ltar grags //
translated: but rather of what is renowned in the world.

original: de la de bzhin brten nas ni //
analyzed: de la de bzhin brten nas ni //
translated: There, based on that,

original: bsgrub bya sgrub byed rab gnas pa //
analyzed: bsgrub bya sgrub byed rab gnas pa //
translated: the object of attainment and the means of attainment are well-established.

original: dam pa'i don la 'jug bya'i phyir //
analyzed: dam pa'i don la 'jug bya'i phyir //
translated: In order to enter the ultimate meaning,üîΩthe wise examine the means of attainment

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis sgrub pa dang // bsgrub bya yang dag gnas pa brtags //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis sgrub pa dang // bsgrub bya yang dag gnas pa brtags //
translated: and the correct establishment of the object of attainment.

original: zhes bya ba bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bshad do //
translated: And:

original: yang ; dpag bya dpag pa'i 'bras gnas pa //
analyzed: yang ; dpag bya dpag pa'i 'bras gnas pa //
translated: The object of inference and the result of inference

original: yod pa min yang gzung ba dang // 'dzin pa rig pa ji lta bur //
analyzed: yod pa min yang gzung ba dang // 'dzin pa rig pa ji lta bur //
translated: do not exist, yet how is the awareness of the apprehended

original: rjes su snang bzhin rab bshad do //üîΩde lta min na sna tshogs kyi //üîΩngo bo snang ba'i dngos gcig la //
analyzed: rjes su snang bzhin rab bshad do // de lta min na sna tshogs kyi // ngo bo snang ba'i dngos gcig la //
translated: and apprehender explained as appearing?üîΩOtherwise, how could a single entityüîΩwith the appearance of a manifold nature

original: rnam pa ji ltar bden 'gyur te //
analyzed: rnam pa ji ltar bden 'gyur te //
translated: be truly existent?

original: gcig pa nyid de nyams par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid de nyams par 'gyur // zhes bshad do //
translated: and the identity of the two would be lost.

original: yang 'di ni tha snyad las byung ba'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes kyang bshad do //üîΩtshad @172a * //
analyzed: yang 'di ni tha snyad las byung ba'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes kyang bshad do // tshad @172a * //
translated: This is also said to be the definition of valid cognition that arises from verbal testimony.

original: ma'i mtshan nyid 'di thams cad ni de kho na nyid la 'jug par bya ba'i ched kho na yin no //
analyzed: ma'i mtshan nyid 'di thams cad ni de kho na nyid la 'jug par bya ba'i ched kho na yin no //
translated: All of these definitions of valid cognition are for the purpose of entering into reality alone.

original: de lta ma yin na thams cad don med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thams cad don med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, everything would be meaningless.

original: 'di ltar tshad ma'i mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos ma bslabs pa gnag rdzi'i chung ma la sogs pa yan chad lung med par yang du ba la sogs pa'i rtags mthong ba'i sgo nas me la sogs pa rtog par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshad ma'i mtshan nyid kyi bstan bcos ma bslabs pa gnag rdzi'i chung ma la sogs pa yan chad lung med par yang du ba la sogs pa'i rtags mthong ba'i sgo nas me la sogs pa rtog par 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: For, without instruction in the treatise on the definition of valid cognition, even the wife of a cowherd and so on would understand fire and so on by seeing smoke and so on as a reason.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag kyang de kho na nyid la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag kyang de kho na nyid la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, we also are for the purpose of entering into reality alone.

original: de bzhin nyid du tha snyad kyi sgo nas rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa rab tu 'jug par byed pas nyes pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du tha snyad kyi sgo nas rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa rab tu 'jug par byed pas nyes pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Since we engage in inference and so on by way of convention in that way, there is no fault.

original: gzhan yang tha snyad kyi sgo nas rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa 'jug pa la yang gang la mi rtag pa la sogs pa dngos po'i chos yod pa'i ngo bo sgrub par 'dod pa de la ni gdon mi za bar tha snyad kyi sgo nas dngos porüîΩgyur pa'i chos can la sogs pa dgos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang tha snyad kyi sgo nas rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa 'jug pa la yang gang la mi rtag pa la sogs pa dngos po'i chos yod pa'i ngo bo sgrub par 'dod pa de la ni gdon mi za bar tha snyad kyi sgo nas dngos por gyur pa'i chos can la sogs pa dgos te /
translated: Moreover, when one engages in inference and so on through the medium of conventions, then one who wishes to establish the nature of the existence of such things as impermanence must definitely have a subject that is a thing through the medium of conventions.

original: de la de lta bu'i gzhi med par bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa 'ba' zhig gnas par grub pa ni med do //
analyzed: de la de lta bu'i gzhi med par bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa 'ba' zhig gnas par grub pa ni med do //
translated: For, without such a basis, it is not established that the probandum and so on exist alone.

original: de nyid la de lta bu'i gzhi med na bsgrub par bya ba bkag pa'i phyir gzhi ma grub pa nyid kyi nyes pa rjod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid la de lta bu'i gzhi med na bsgrub par bya ba bkag pa'i phyir gzhi ma grub pa nyid kyi nyes pa rjod par byed pa yin no //
translated: And when there is no such basis, then one can rightly accuse one of the fault of having a nonestablished subject, because the probandum is refuted.

original: de la yang chos can ji lta ba bzhin du gyur pa kho na log na gdon mi za bar bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa'i chos rang med na mi 'byung ba bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: de la yang chos can ji lta ba bzhin du gyur pa kho na log na gdon mi za bar bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa'i chos rang med na mi 'byung ba bkag pa yin te /
translated: And in that case, if the subject is just as it is, then when it is refuted, then the probandum and so on are necessarily refuted, because they are invariably concomitant with it.

original: de ma grub na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'i nyes pa rjod par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ma grub na gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'i nyes pa rjod par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: If that is not established, then the faults of the reason being unestablished and so on are expressed.

original: rang da gar nye bar brtags pa'i chos can 'ga' zhig log kyang bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa bkag pa 'ga' yang med pa de la ni ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'i nyes pa brjod pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: rang da gar nye bar brtags pa'i chos can 'ga' zhig log kyang bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa bkag pa 'ga' yang med pa de la ni ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'i nyes pa brjod pa mi rigs te /
translated: But when there is no negation of the probandum and so on, it is illogical to express the faults of the reason being unestablished and so on,

original: de la 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa la gags byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang la dngos po'i chos yod pa'i ngo bor sgrub par mi 'dod kyi 'on kyang sgro btags pa'i chos rnam par gcad pa sgrub pa tsam zhig brjod par 'dod pa de la ni ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'i nyes pa brjod pa tha snyad du yang dngos
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa la gags byed pa med pa'i phyir ro // gang la dngos po'i chos yod pa'i ngo bor sgrub par mi 'dod kyi 'on kyang sgro btags pa'i chos rnam par gcad pa sgrub pa tsam zhig brjod par 'dod pa de la ni ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'i nyes pa brjod pa tha snyad du yang dngos
translated: because there is no obstruction to the accomplishment of the desired aim.

original: por gyur pa'i chos can mi dgos te /
analyzed: por gyur pa'i chos can mi dgos te /
translated: For one who does not wish to prove the nature of an entity that has the quality of an existent thing, but who wishes to state only the mere proof that eliminates a superimposition of a quality, it is not necessary to have a subject that is an existent thing even nominally.

original: de ni de'i chos ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i chos ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is not a quality of that.

original: de la ltos nas kyang de'i chos can nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ltos nas kyang de'i chos can nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and in dependence on that, it is not tenable that it is the property of the subject.

original: de ma grub tu zin kyang bsgrub par bya ba med na de mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub @172b pa la gags byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrgol ba'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa la gnod pa byed pa don du gnyer ba'i phyir rgol ba ni chos can 'grub pa'am /
analyzed: de ma grub tu zin kyang bsgrub par bya ba med na de mi 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub @172b pa la gags byed pa med pa'i phyir ro // rgol ba'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don 'grub pa la gnod pa byed pa don du gnyer ba'i phyir rgol ba ni chos can 'grub pa'am /
translated: Even if it is not established, if the probandum does not occur, the reason is not a reason that is accepted as accomplishing the desired aim, because it does not create an obstacle.

original: ma grub pa tshol bar byed kyi /
analyzed: ma grub pa tshol bar byed kyi /
translated: Because he seeks to create an obstacle to the accomplishment of the desired aim of the challenger, the challenger seeks to establish or to refute the property of the subject.

original: chags pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chags pas ni ma yin no //
translated: He does not do so out of attachment.

original: gang la chos can ma grub pa la sogs pa glengs kyang rgol ba'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don la gnod pa med pa kho na yin pa de la ni de glengs pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: gang la chos can ma grub pa la sogs pa glengs kyang rgol ba'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don la gnod pa med pa kho na yin pa de la ni de glengs pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: If the challenger‚Äôs desired aim is not undermined even when the nonestablishment of the property of the subject and so on are mentioned, then what is the point of mentioning them?

translated: It is not logical that when another thing is established, one can conventionally designate it as another.

original: mi shes pa kha cig gis so sor brtags pas 'gog pa la sogs pa 'dus ma byas gsum po gang gi yang skyed par byed pa nyid du ma gyur pa gang dag yang dag par dngos por kun brtags pa de dag dgag par bsgrub par bya ba la
analyzed: mi shes pa kha cig gis so sor brtags pas 'gog pa la sogs pa 'dus ma byas gsum po gang gi yang skyed par byed pa nyid du ma gyur pa gang dag yang dag par dngos por kun brtags pa de dag dgag par bsgrub par bya ba la
translated: In order to refute them, we say:

original: yang ji ltar blo chos can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang ji ltar blo chos can du 'gyur te /
translated: How can the mind be the subject?

original: pha rol po dag de la des bskyed par bya ba nyid kyi chos khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol po dag de la des bskyed par bya ba nyid kyi chos khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the opponent does not accept that it is a thing that is caused by that.

original: de'i phyir de dgag pa ni nam yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dgag pa ni nam yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, its refutation will never be established.üîΩIf the mind is the subject, then the reason is not established for the essentialist,üîΩbut if the mind is not the subject, then there is no common observation of the reason.

original: ji ste thog ma med pa'i rang gi sa bon yongs su smin pa las yang dag par byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas yongs su bsgrubs pa /
analyzed: ji ste thog ma med pa'i rang gi sa bon yongs su smin pa las yang dag par byung ba'i rnam par rtog pas yongs su bsgrubs pa /
translated: If the mind is the subject, then the reason is not established for the essentialist, because he does not accept that the mind is produced from the ripening of its own beginningless seeds and is fabricated by the conceptualizing mind.

original: byis pa rnams kyis phyi rol dang dngos po nyid du nye bar brtags pa blo la yod pa nyid chos can yin te /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis phyi rol dang dngos po nyid du nye bar brtags pa blo la yod pa nyid chos can yin te /
translated: But if the mind is not the subject, then there is no common observation of the reason by both parties.

original: de'i phyir de la brten nas gtso bo la sogs pa 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la brten nas gtso bo la sogs pa 'gog par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not established.

original: de ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med kyang rnam par 'khrul pa'i dbang gis phyi rol lta bu dang / gtso bo la sogs pa dang / tha mi dad pa lta bu dang / nus pas stong pa la sogs pa'i chos mtha' dag dang ldan pa lta bur rtog go //
analyzed: de ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med kyang rnam par 'khrul pa'i dbang gis phyi rol lta bu dang / gtso bo la sogs pa dang / tha mi dad pa lta bu dang / nus pas stong pa la sogs pa'i chos mtha' dag dang ldan pa lta bur rtog go //
translated: Although it is ultimately devoid of intrinsic reality, due to the power of error it is imagined to be like an external object, like something not distinct from the principal and so on, and like something endowed with all the properties of being empty of the capacity and so on.

original: de la gtso bo la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dgag pa sgrub pa la gtso bo la sogs pa dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa dag gzhi gcig pa nyid kyang grub pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de la gtso bo la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dgag pa sgrub pa la gtso bo la sogs pa dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa dag gzhi gcig pa nyid kyang grub pa kho na yin te /
translated: In this regard, the establishment of the negation of the intrinsic reality of the principal and so on is also the establishment of the negation of the principal and so on as the basis of the property to be established and the proof.

original: 'di ltar de nyid byis pa rnams kyis phyi rol dang / gtso bo la sogs pa nyid du nye bar bzung ba rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba dag kyang rab rib can gyis zla ba gnyis su mthong ba bzhin du de dang tha mi dad par sems pa kho nas tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de nyid byis pa rnams kyis phyi rol dang / gtso bo la sogs pa nyid du nye bar bzung ba rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba dag kyang rab rib can gyis zla ba gnyis su mthong ba bzhin du de dang tha mi dad par sems pa kho nas tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, just as the childish apprehend it as external and as the principal and so on, the proponent and opponent merely impute it as such, thinking that it is not distinct from that, like the two moons seen by one with myodesopsia.

original: @174b de ni blos kun brtags pa yin yang de'i rnam pa nyid kyis blo zhes nye bar 'dogs te /
analyzed: @174b de ni blos kun brtags pa yin yang de'i rnam pa nyid kyis blo zhes nye bar 'dogs te /
translated: Although that is imagined by the mind, it is designated as mind because it has the aspect of mind.

original: 'di dngos su ni blo'i ngo bo yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dngos su ni blo'i ngo bo yang ma yin te /
translated: In reality, it is not the nature of mind,

original: de ni de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it appears as a nature that is not similar to that.

original: de'i phyir de ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rab tu bsgrubs kyang blo ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du thal ba ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir de ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rab tu bsgrubs kyang blo ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du thal ba ni ma yin te ;
translated: Therefore, although it is well established that it is realityless, it does not follow that mind is realityless.

original: de la phyi rol dang gtso bo la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dgag pa tshad mas sgrub par byed kyi /
analyzed: de la phyi rol dang gtso bo la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dgag pa tshad mas sgrub par byed kyi /
translated: In that regard, the reality of external things, primal nature, etc., is established by validating cognition,

original: de nyid dgag pa'i phyir gtan tshigs sbyor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid dgag pa'i phyir gtan tshigs sbyor ba ma yin no //
translated: but the argument is not applied in order to negate that.

original: gang la phyi rol gyi chos can sgra la sogs pa dngos por gyur pa yod pa de la yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos rab tu sgrub pa la blo la yod pa'i chos can phyi rol gyi sgra la sogs pa dang / tha mi dad pa nye bar brtags pa de nyid la kun du brten par byed pa yin te /üîΩphyi rol gyi sgra la sogs pa yul dang / dus dang gnas skabs tha dad par nges pa dag ni rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba'i blo la rang gi ngo bor mngon sum du mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la phyi rol gyi chos can sgra la sogs pa dngos por gyur pa yod pa de la yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos rab tu sgrub pa la blo la yod pa'i chos can phyi rol gyi sgra la sogs pa dang / tha mi dad pa nye bar brtags pa de nyid la kun du brten par byed pa yin te / phyi rol gyi sgra la sogs pa yul dang / dus dang gnas skabs tha dad par nges pa dag ni rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba'i blo la rang gi ngo bor mngon sum du mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the case of a subject that is an external thing, such as sound, which is a real entity, the property to be proven, such as impermanence, is also based on the subject that exists in the mind, which is the external sound, etc., that is imagined to be nondifferent from it.üîΩThis is because the different objects, times, and circumstances of external sounds, etc., are not directly perceptible to the minds of the proponent and opponent as their own nature.

original: 'di la cha shas med pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi bye brag rnams mi srid pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la cha shas med pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi bye brag rnams mi srid pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: And in this case, the distinctions of the property to be proven, the proof, etc., are impossible because of the absence of parts.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag par bya ba dang / rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'di thams cad ni blo la yod pa'i chos can kho na la brten nas 'jug pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag par bya ba dang / rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'di thams cad ni blo la yod pa'i chos can kho na la brten nas 'jug pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, all of these conventions, such as the inferential evidence and the inferential subject, are used only in dependence on a subject that exists for the mind,

original: rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: because it is impossible for them to exist in any other way.

original: gal te de lta yin na /üîΩ'o na don dam par ngo bo nyid med kyang kun brtags pa'i chos can la brten nas dgag pa la sogs pa rab tu sgrub par byed pa la yang gzhi ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'i nyes pa mi 'jug na ci ste nan gyis kho bo cag
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na / 'o na don dam par ngo bo nyid med kyang kun brtags pa'i chos can la brten nas dgag pa la sogs pa rab tu sgrub par byed pa la yang gzhi ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'i nyes pa mi 'jug na ci ste nan gyis kho bo cag
translated: If that is so,üîΩthen even though ultimately there is no intrinsic reality, when one establishes a negation, etc., in dependence on a subject that is an imagined object, why do you insist on seeking out faults in us,

original: la klan ka tshol bar byed /
analyzed: la klan ka tshol bar byed /
translated: such as the fallacy of having no basis?

original: ji ltar khyed don dam pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir gtso bo la sogs pa dgag par kun brtags pa'i chos can kho na la bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i sems pa rgyas par byed pa de bzhin du kho bo cag kyang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa grags pa dag la /üîΩyod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du sgro btags pa dgag par byis pa rnams la de dag sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang / gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar khyed don dam pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir gtso bo la sogs pa dgag par kun brtags pa'i chos can kho na la bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i sems pa rgyas par byed pa de bzhin du kho bo cag kyang gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa grags pa dag la / yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du sgro btags pa dgag par byis pa rnams la de dag sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang / gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: Just as you extensively apply the thought of the probandum and proof to only the imagined subject, in order to engage with the ultimate and refute the primal matter and so on, in the same way, we also teach to the childish that forms, sounds, and so on, which are renowned, are similar to illusions, mirages, dreams, and reflections, in order to refute the superimposition of the nature of existence, nonexistence, and so on.

original: de la ji ltar brtags pa'i chos can la dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du sgro btags pa la sogs pa bkag tu zin kyang rgol ba dang phyir @175a * //
analyzed: de la ji ltar brtags pa'i chos can la dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du sgro btags pa la sogs pa bkag tu zin kyang rgol ba dang phyir @175a * //
translated: Although the superimposition of the nature of entities and so on to the subject imagined in that way is refuted, the opponent still clings to the subject as real.

original: rgol ba dag la snang ba'i phyir ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'i nyes pa mi 'jug pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa yang gnag rdzi'i chung ma yan chad kyi skye bo la snang ba'i phyir ji ltar ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: rgol ba dag la snang ba'i phyir ma grub pa nyid la sogs pa'i nyes pa mi 'jug pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa yang gnag rdzi'i chung ma yan chad kyi skye bo la snang ba'i phyir ji ltar ma grub pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: Just as the faults of unestablished and so on do not apply to the example of the reflection because it appears to the opponent, so too form and so on are not unestablished because they appear to everyone from cowherds to householders.

original: snang ba ni gang gis na de log na ldog par 'gyur ba bden pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis khyab pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba ni gang gis na de log na ldog par 'gyur ba bden pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis khyab pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is appearance pervaded by true reality such that if the latter is refuted, the former is refuted,

original: brdzun pa yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdzun pa yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even false things appear.

original: de lta ma yin na skye bo thams cad de kho na nyid mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na skye bo thams cad de kho na nyid mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, everyone would see reality,

original: de kho na 'ba' zhig snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na 'ba' zhig snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because only reality would appear.

original: ji ltar kun brtags pa'i chos can de la yang ngo bo nyid med pa yang dag par 'grub par bya ba'i phyir nus pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'i chos nye bar 'god pa des khyab pa nyid kyis gtso bo la sogs pa la de rab tu grub
analyzed: ji ltar kun brtags pa'i chos can de la yang ngo bo nyid med pa yang dag par 'grub par bya ba'i phyir nus pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'i chos nye bar 'god pa des khyab pa nyid kyis gtso bo la sogs pa la de rab tu grub
translated: Just as the qualities of being devoid of power and so on are adduced to establish the essencelessness of the imagined reality, by the pervasion of that, the qualities of being devoid of power and so on are established in the primal matter and so on.

original: par byed pa de bzhin du kho bo cag yang dag pa nyid du kun brtags pa'i dngos po thams cad la de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir yang dag pa la nus pa med pa la sogs pa smos pa yang ci ste sgrub par mi byed gzhan yang rtog
analyzed: par byed pa de bzhin du kho bo cag yang dag pa nyid du kun brtags pa'i dngos po thams cad la de rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir yang dag pa la nus pa med pa la sogs pa smos pa yang ci ste sgrub par mi byed gzhan yang rtog
translated: Just as you do, we also do not establish anything in reality, because all things that are imagined to be real are powerless to be established in reality.

original: pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis khas len pa ni dpyad pa'i 'og tu yin la /
analyzed: pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis khas len pa ni dpyad pa'i 'og tu yin la /
translated: Moreover, those who are endowed with discernment accept the analysis after it has been done.

original: de'i bdag nyid gtan la phab na rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid gtan la phab na rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is reasonable to determine the nature of something after it has been analyzed.

original: dpyod pa'i dus na ni ma yin te /üîΩde'i phyir de gtan lam phab pa'i phyir dang / dpyod pa yang de gtan la dbab pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i dus na ni ma yin te / de'i phyir de gtan lam phab pa'i phyir dang / dpyod pa yang de gtan la dbab pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable to do so while it is being analyzed.üîΩTherefore, it is because the analysis is for the purpose of determining the nature of something that we do not accept any philosophical position while it is being analyzed.

original: de'i phyir tshad mas de kho na nyid gtan la 'bebs pa'i dus na su yang grub pa'i mtha' khas len pa med pas de'i tshe gang la gzhi ma grub pa'i sgo nas chos can ma grub pa la sogs pas rgol bar byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad mas de kho na nyid gtan la 'bebs pa'i dus na su yang grub pa'i mtha' khas len pa med pas de'i tshe gang la gzhi ma grub pa'i sgo nas chos can ma grub pa la sogs pas rgol bar byed de /
translated: Thus, when valid cognition determines reality, no one accepts a philosophical position. At that time, what is there to debate about the lack of a basis, the lack of a subject, and so on?

original: 'on te de kho na nyid 'di rgol ba bdag nyid kyis sngar tshad mas gtan la phab nas gzhan dag la de bsgrub par 'dod pas zhugs pa yin pas de'i phyir de grub pa'i mtha' khas len pa'i snga na gnas pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar
analyzed: 'on te de kho na nyid 'di rgol ba bdag nyid kyis sngar tshad mas gtan la phab nas gzhan dag la de bsgrub par 'dod pas zhugs pa yin pas de'i phyir de grub pa'i mtha' khas len pa'i snga na gnas pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar
translated: Or do you assert that this challenger first determines suchness by means of a valid being and then engages in debate with the desire to prove it to others?

original: 'dod na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If you assert the latter, that is illogical.

original: bdag nyid rtogs par byed pa'i dus na grub pa'i mtha' khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid rtogs par byed pa'i dus na grub pa'i mtha' khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when one is realizing it for oneself, one does not accept tenets.

original: sngar grub pa'i mtha' khas ma blangs pa'i rgol ba bdag nyid tshad ma gang kho nas de kho na nyid rtogs par gyur pa de nyid kyis gzhan la rtogs par byed na ji ltar grub pa'i mtha' khas blangs pa zhes bya /
analyzed: sngar grub pa'i mtha' khas ma blangs pa'i rgol ba bdag nyid tshad ma gang kho nas de kho na nyid rtogs par gyur pa de nyid kyis gzhan la rtogs par byed na ji ltar grub pa'i mtha' khas blangs pa zhes bya /
translated: If the challenger realizes suchness by means of a valid cognition and then makes others realize it by means of that very valid cognition, how could it be said that he accepts tenets?

original: 'di bdag nyid sngar tshad mas de kho na nyid gtan la phab na gzhan dag la grub pa'i mtha' kho nas rtogs par byed pa yang ma grub la /
analyzed: 'di bdag nyid sngar tshad mas de kho na nyid gtan la phab na gzhan dag la grub pa'i mtha' kho nas rtogs par byed pa yang ma grub la /
translated: It is not established that he makes others realize suchness by means of tenets alone, having previously determined suchness by means of a valid cognition himself.

original: gzhan rtog pa dang ldan pa yang de'i tshig tsam gyis tshad ma med pa'i @175b don yid ches par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan rtog pa dang ldan pa yang de'i tshig tsam gyis tshad ma med pa'i @175b don yid ches par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, others who have conceptions will not come to believe the meaning of a nonvalid cognition just by your mere words.

original: de bas na bdag nyid gtan la 'bebs pa'i dus bzhin du gzhan la ston pa'i dus na yang 'dra ba'i phyir thams cad du tshad ma kho nas de kho na nyid gtan la phab na su yang grub pa'i mtha' khas len pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar de'i
analyzed: de bas na bdag nyid gtan la 'bebs pa'i dus bzhin du gzhan la ston pa'i dus na yang 'dra ba'i phyir thams cad du tshad ma kho nas de kho na nyid gtan la phab na su yang grub pa'i mtha' khas len pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar de'i
translated: Therefore, just as at the time of ascertaining for oneself, at the time of teaching others, since it is the same, if one ascertains reality by means of valid cognition alone, then since no one would accept tenets, how could one

original: sgo nas chos can ma grub pa la sogs brjod par byed /
analyzed: sgo nas chos can ma grub pa la sogs brjod par byed /
translated: state, ‚ÄúThe subject is not established‚Äù and so on?

original: tshad ma yang dag pa'i stobs kyis rgol ba'i mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba grub kyang /
analyzed: tshad ma yang dag pa'i stobs kyis rgol ba'i mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba grub kyang /
translated: Even though the probandum that is desired by the opponent is established by the power of a correct valid cognition,

original: grub pa'i mtha' khas blangs pas de la de gnod par byed do zhes zer ba 'di la gzhan rigs pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' khas blangs pas de la de gnod par byed do zhes zer ba 'di la gzhan rigs pa ci zhig yod /
translated: what other logic is there for saying, ‚ÄúIt is undermined by the acceptance of tenets‚Äù?

original: dngos po'i de kho na nyid bsam pa la ni grub pa'i mtha' las yang dag par grags pa'i chos can la su yang rten par mi byed de /
analyzed: dngos po'i de kho na nyid bsam pa la ni grub pa'i mtha' las yang dag par grags pa'i chos can la su yang rten par mi byed de /
translated: As for the consideration of the reality of things, no one relies on a subject that is well known in the philosophical systems.

original: de lta bu'i chos can ni rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba dag la gang du yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos can ni rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba dag la gang du yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such a subject is not established for either the proponent or the opponent.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa sgra la sogs pa'i chos can 'byung ba las gyur pa la sogs pa ji lta bur mngon par 'dod pa de lta bur bye brag pa la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa sgra la sogs pa'i chos can 'byung ba las gyur pa la sogs pa ji lta bur mngon par 'dod pa de lta bur bye brag pa la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the Buddhist does not accept the Vai≈õe·π£ika‚Äôs theory that the subject, sound, is derived from the elements, and so on.

original: de dag gis de nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa nye bar brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis de nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa nye bar brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Vai≈õe·π£ika imputes to it the quality of being a quality of space, and so on.

original: de'i phyir chos can de lta bu ma grub na su yang gang du yang sgrub pa 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos can de lta bu ma grub na su yang gang du yang sgrub pa 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if such a subject is not established, no one would engage in a proof of anything to anyone.

original: 'on te chos can de lta bu grub na ni de'i chos kyang gnyi ga la grub pa kho na yin pas rtsod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te chos can de lta bu grub na ni de'i chos kyang gnyi ga la grub pa kho na yin pas rtsod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if such a subject is established, then its property would be established for both parties, and there would be no dispute.

original: de lta bas na de kho na nyid rtogs par 'dod pa thams cad ni gzhung lugs kyis bsgrubs pa'i chos can gyi bye brag spangs te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de kho na nyid rtogs par 'dod pa thams cad ni gzhung lugs kyis bsgrubs pa'i chos can gyi bye brag spangs te /
translated: Therefore, all who wish to understand reality should abandon the particular subjects established by the philosophical systems and

original: gnag rdzi yan chad la grags pa 'di nyid la brten nas bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i sems pa rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: gnag rdzi yan chad la grags pa 'di nyid la brten nas bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i sems pa rgyas par byed do //
translated: should base themselves on what is renowned to everyone, from cowherds on up, and thereby expand their thoughts about the probandum and the proof.

original: de'i phyir grub pa'i mtha' la brten nas gzhi ma grub pa la sogs pas gleng ba ni 'brel pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir grub pa'i mtha' la brten nas gzhi ma grub pa la sogs pas gleng ba ni 'brel pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is completely irrelevant to raise objections such as ‚ÄúThe subject is not established‚Äù on the basis of philosophical tenets.

original: gang la tha snyad du yang chos can la sogs pa rab tu ma grub pa la sogs pa de la 'di gleng ba rigs pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: gang la tha snyad du yang chos can la sogs pa rab tu ma grub pa la sogs pa de la 'di gleng ba rigs pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: It is only right to raise such objections in regard to those subjects, etc., that are not established even conventionally.

original: kho bo cag la ni gzugs la sogs pa tha snyad du yang rab tu ma grub pa ma yin no //
